In the midst of the young women beating tambourines.
68.26:
Bless God in the congregations,
Even the Lord, you who are of the fountain of Israel.
68.27:
Benjamin, the youngest, is there, ruling them,
The leaders of Judah in their company,
The leaders of Zebulun, the leaders of Naphtali.
68.28:
Your God has commanded your strength;
Show Yourself strong, God, You who acted in our behalf.
68.29:
Because of Your temple at Jerusalem
Kings will bring gifts to You.
68.30:
Rebuke the animals in the reeds,
The herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples,
Trampling the pieces of silver;
He has scattered the peoples who delight in war.
68.31:
Messengers will come from Egypt;
Cush will quickly stretch out her hands to God.
68.32:
Sing to God, you kingdoms of the earth,
Sing praises to the Lord, Selah
68.33:
To Him who rides upon the highest heavens, which are from ancient times;
Behold, He speaks with His voice, a mighty voice.
68.35:
God, You are awesome from Your sanctuary.
The God of Israel Himself gives strength and power to the people.
Blessed be God!

69.1:
Save me, God,
For the waters have threatened my life.
69.2:
I have sunk in deep mud, and there is no foothold;
I have come into deep waters, and a flood overflows me.
69.3:
I am weary with my crying; my throat is parched;
My eyes fail while I wait for my God.
69.5:
God, You know my foolishness,
And my guilt is not hidden from You.
69.6:
May those who wait for You not be ashamed because of me, Lord God of armies;
May those who seek You not be dishonored because of me, God of Israel,
69.7:
Because for Your sake I have endured disgrace;
Dishonor has covered my face.
69.8:
I have become estranged from my brothers,
And a stranger to my mother’s sons.
69.9:
For zeal for Your house has consumed me,
And the taunts of those who taunt You have fallen on me.
69.10:
When I wept in my soul with fasting,
It became my disgrace.
69.11:
When I made sackcloth my clothing,
I became a proverb to them.
69.12:
Those who sit in the gate talk about me,
And songs of mockery by those habitually drunk are about me.
69.14:
Rescue me from the mud and do not let me sink;
May I be rescued from those who hate me, and from the depths of water.
69.15:
May the flood of water not overflow me
Nor the deep swallow me up,
Nor the pit close its mouth on me.
69.16:
Answer me, Lord, for Your mercy is good;
According to the greatness of Your compassion, turn to me,
69.17:
And do not hide Your face from Your servant,
For I am in distress; answer me quickly.
69.18:
Come near to my soul and redeem it;
Ransom me because of my enemies!
69.19:
You know my disgrace, my shame, and my dishonor;
All my enemies are known to You.
69.21:
They also gave me a bitter herb in my food,
And for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
69.22:
May their table before them become a snare;
And when they are at peace, may it become a trap.
69.23:
May their eyes grow dim so that they cannot see,
And make their hips shake continually.
69.24:
Pour out Your indignation on them,
And may Your burning anger overtake them.
69.25:
May their camp be desolated;
May there be none living in their tents.
69.26:
For they have persecuted him whom You Yourself struck,
And they tell of the pain of those whom You have wounded.
69.27:
Add guilt to their guilt,
And may they not come into Your righteousness.
69.28:
May they be wiped out of the book of life,
And may they not be recorded with the righteous.
69.29:
But I am afflicted and in pain;
May Your salvation, God, set me safely on high.
69.30:
I will praise the name of God with song,
And exalt Him with thanksgiving.
69.31:
And it will please the Lord better than an ox
Or bull with horns and hoofs.
69.32:
The humble have seen it and are glad;
You who seek God, let your heart revive.
69.33:
For the Lord hears the needy,
And does not despise those of His who are prisoners.
69.34:
Heaven and earth shall praise Him,
The seas and everything that moves in them.
69.35:
For God will save Zion and build the cities of Judah,
So that they may live there and possess it.
69.36:
The descendants of His servants will inherit it,
And those who love His name will live in it.

70.1:
God, hurry to save me;
Lord, hurry to help me!
70.2:
May those who seek my life
Be put to shame and humiliated;
May those who delight in my harm
Be turned back and dishonored.
70.3:
May those who say, “Aha, aha!” be turned back
Because of their shame.

71.1:
In You, Lord, I have taken refuge;
Let me never be put to shame.
71.2:
In Your righteousness rescue me and save me;
Extend Your ear to me and help me.
71.4:
Save me, my God, from the hand of the wicked,
From the grasp of the wrongdoer and the ruthless,
71.5:
For You are my hope;
Lord God, You are my confidence from my youth.
71.7:
I have become a marvel to many,
For You are my strong refuge.
71.8:
My mouth is filled with Your praise
And with Your glory all day long.
71.9:
Do not cast me away at the time of my old age;
Do not abandon me when my strength fails.
71.10:
For my enemies have spoken against me;
And those who watch for my life have consulted together,
71.11:
Saying, “God has abandoned him;
Pursue and seize him, for there is no one to save him.”
71.12:
God, do not be far from me;
My God, hurry to my aid!
71.13:
May those who are enemies of my soul be put to shame and consumed;
May they be covered with disgrace and dishonor, who seek to injure me.
71.14:
But as for me, I will wait continually,
And will praise You yet more and more.
71.16:
I will come with the mighty deeds of the Lord God;
I will make mention of Your righteousness, Yours alone.
71.17:
God, You have taught me from my youth,
And I still declare Your wondrous deeds.
71.18:
And even when I am old and gray, God, do not abandon me,
Until I declare Your strength to this generation,
Your power to all who are to come.
71.20:
You who have shown me many troubles and distresses
Will revive me again,
And will bring me up again from the depths of the earth.
71.21:
May You increase my greatness
And turn to comfort me.
71.22:
I will also praise You with a harp,
And Your truth, my God;
I will sing praises to You with the lyre,
Holy One of Israel.
71.23:
My lips will shout for joy when I sing praises to You;
And my soul, which You have redeemed.
71.24:
My tongue also will tell of Your righteousness all day long;
For they are put to shame, for they are humiliated who seek my harm.

72.1:
Give the king Your judgments, God,
And Your righteousness to the king’s son.
72.2:
May he judge Your people with righteousness
And Your afflicted with justice.
72.3:
May the mountains bring peace to the people,
And the hills, in righteousness.
72.4:
May he vindicate the afflicted of the people,
Save the children of the needy,
And crush the oppressor.
72.5:
May they fear You while the sun shines,
And as long as the moon shines, throughout all generations.
72.6:
May he come down like rain upon the mown grass,
Like showers that water the earth.
72.7:
May the righteous flourish in his days,
As well as an abundance of peace, until the moon is no more.
72.8:
May he also rule from sea to sea,
And from the Euphrates River to the ends of the earth.
72.9:
May the nomads of the desert bow before him,
And his enemies lick the dust.
72.10:
May the kings of Tarshish and of the islands bring gifts;
May the kings of Sheba and Seba offer tributes.
72.11:
And may all kings bow down before him,
All nations serve him.
72.12:
For he will save the needy when he cries for help,
The afflicted also, and him who has no helper.
72.13:
He will have compassion on the poor and needy,
And he will save the lives of the needy.
72.14:
He will rescue their life from oppression and violence,
And their blood will be precious in his sight;
72.18:
Blessed be the Lord God, the God of Israel,
Who alone works wonders.
72.20: The prayers of David the son of Jesse are ended.

73.1:
God certainly is good to Israel,
To those who are pure in heart!
73.2:
But as for me, my feet came close to stumbling,
My steps had almost slipped.
73.3:
For I was envious of the arrogant
As I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
73.4:
For there are no pains in their death,
And their belly is fat.
73.5:
They are not in trouble like other people,
Nor are they tormented together with the rest of mankind.
73.6:
Therefore arrogance is their necklace;
The garment of violence covers them.
73.7:
Their eye bulges from fatness;
The imaginations of their heart overflow.
73.8:
They mock and wickedly speak of oppression;
They speak from on high.
73.9:
They have set their mouth against the heavens,
And their tongue parades through the earth.
73.10:
Therefore his people return here,
And abundant waters are drunk by them.
73.11:
They say, “How does God know?
And is there knowledge with the Most High?”
73.12:
Behold, these are the wicked;
And always at ease, they have increased in wealth.
73.13:
Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure
And washed my hands in innocence;
73.14:
For I have been stricken all day long,
And punished every morning.
73.15:
If I had said, “I will speak this way,”
Behold, I would have betrayed the generation of Your children.
73.16:
When I thought of understanding this,
It was troublesome in my sight
73.17:
Until I entered the sanctuary of God;
Then I perceived their end.
73.18:
You indeed put them on slippery ground;
You dropped them into ruin.
73.19:
How they are destroyed in a moment!
They are utterly swept away by sudden terrors!
73.20:
Like a dream when one awakes,
Lord, when stirred, You will despise their image.
73.21:
When my heart was embittered
And I was pierced within,
73.22:
Then I was stupid and ignorant;
I was like an animal before You.
73.23:
Nevertheless I am continually with You;
You have taken hold of my right hand.
73.24:
You will guide me with Your plan,
And afterward receive me to glory.
73.25:
Whom do I have in heaven but You?
And with You, I desire nothing on earth.
73.26:
My flesh and my heart may fail,
But God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
73.27:
For, behold, those who are far from You will perish;
You have destroyed all those who are unfaithful to You.

74.1:
God, why have You rejected us forever?
Why does Your anger smoke against the sheep of Your pasture?
74.3:
Step toward the irreparable ruins;
The enemy has damaged everything in the sanctuary.
74.4:
Your adversaries have roared in the midst of Your meeting place;
They have set up their own signs as signs.
74.5:
It seems like one bringing up
His axe into a forest of trees.
74.6:
And now they break down all its carved work
With axe and hammers.
74.7:
They have burned Your sanctuary to the ground;
They have defiled the dwelling place of Your name.
74.8:
They said in their heart, “Let’s completely subdue them.”
They have burned all the meeting places of God in the land.
74.10:
How long, God, will the enemy taunt You?
Shall the enemy treat Your name disrespectfully forever?
74.11:
Why do You withdraw Your hand, even Your right hand?
Extend it from Your chest and destroy them!
74.12:
Yet God is my King from long ago,
Who performs acts of salvation in the midst of the earth.
74.13:
You divided the sea by Your strength;
You broke the heads of the sea monsters in the waters.
74.14:
You crushed the heads of Leviathan;
You gave him as food for the creatures of the wilderness.
74.15:
You broke open springs and torrents;
You dried up ever-flowing streams.
74.16:
Yours is the day, Yours also is the night;
You have prepared the light and the sun.
74.17:
You have established all the boundaries of the earth;
You have created summer and winter.
74.18:
Remember this, Lord, that the enemy has taunted You,
And a foolish people has treated Your name disrespectfully.
74.19:
Do not give the soul of Your turtledove to the wild animal;
Do not forget the life of Your afflicted forever.
74.20:
Consider the covenant;
For the dark places of the land are full of the places of violence.
74.21:
May the oppressed person not return dishonored;
May the afflicted and the needy praise Your name.
74.22:
Arise, God, and plead Your own cause;
Remember how the foolish person taunts You all day long.
74.23:
Do not forget the voice of Your adversaries,
The uproar of those who rise against You, which ascends continually.

75.2:
“When I select an appointed time,
It is I who judge fairly.
75.3:
The earth and all who inhabit it are unsteady;
It is I who have firmly set its pillars. Selah
75.4:
I said to the boastful, ‘Do not boast,’
And to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up the horn;
75.5:
Do not lift up your horn on high,
Do not speak with insolent pride.’”
75.6:
For not from the east, nor from the west,
Nor from the desert comes exaltation;
75.7:
But God is the Judge;
He puts down one and exalts another.
75.9:
But as for me, I will declare it forever;
I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.
75.10:
And He will cut off all the horns of the wicked,
But the horns of the righteous will be lifted up.

76.1:
God is known in Judah;
His name is great in Israel.
76.2:
His tabernacle is in Salem;
His dwelling place also is in Zion.
76.3:
There He broke the flaming arrows,
The shield, the sword, and the weapons of war. Selah
76.4:
You are resplendent,
More majestic than the mountains of prey.
76.6:
At Your rebuke, God of Jacob,
Both rider and horse were cast into a dead sleep.
76.7:
You, You indeed are to be feared,
And who may stand in Your presence, once You are angry?
76.8:
You caused judgment to be heard from heaven;
The earth feared and was still
76.9:
When God arose to judgment,
To save all the humble of the earth. Selah
76.10:
For the wrath of mankind shall praise You;
You will encircle Yourself with a remnant of wrath.
76.11:
Make vows to the Lord your God and fulfill them;
All who are around Him are to bring gifts to Him who is to be feared.
76.12:
He will cut off the spirit of princes;
He is feared by the kings of the earth.

77.1:
My voice rises to God, and I will cry aloud;
My voice rises to God, and He will listen to me.
77.3:
When I remember God, then I am restless;
When I sigh, then my spirit feels weak. Selah
77.4:
You have held my eyelids open;
I am so troubled that I cannot speak.
77.5:
I have considered the days of old,
The years of long ago.
77.7:
Will the Lord reject forever?
And will He never be favorable again?
77.8:
Has His favor ceased forever?
Has His promise come to an end forever?
77.9:
Has God forgotten to be gracious,
Or has He in anger withdrawn His compassion? Selah
77.10:
Then I said, “It is my grief,
That the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
77.11:
I shall remember the deeds of the Lord;
I will certainly remember Your wonders of old.
77.12:
I will meditate on all Your work,
And on Your deeds with thanksgiving.
77.13:
Your way, God, is holy;
What god is great like our God?
77.14:
You are the God who works wonders;
You have made known Your strength among the peoples.
77.15:
By Your power You have redeemed Your people,
The sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
77.19:
Your way was in the sea
And Your paths in the mighty waters,
And Your footprints were not known.
77.20:
You led Your people like a flock
By the hand of Moses and Aaron.

78.1:
Listen, my people, to my instruction;
Incline your ears to the words of my mouth.
78.2:
I will open my mouth in a parable;
I will tell riddles of old,
78.3:
Which we have heard and known,
And our fathers have told us.
78.4:
We will not conceal them from their children,
But we will tell the generation to come the praises of the Lord,
And His power and His wondrous works that He has done.
78.5:
For He established a testimony in Jacob,
And appointed a law in Israel,
Which He commanded our fathers
That they were to teach them to their children,
78.6:
So that the generation to come would know, the children yet to be born,
That they would arise and tell them to their children,
78.7:
So that they would put their confidence in God
And not forget the works of God,
But comply with His commandments,
78.8:
And not be like their fathers,
A stubborn and rebellious generation,
A generation that did not prepare its heart
And whose spirit was not faithful to God.
78.9:
The sons of Ephraim were archers equipped with bows,
Yet they turned back on the day of battle.
78.10:
They did not keep the covenant of God
And refused to walk in His Law;
78.11:
They forgot His deeds
And His miracles that He had shown them.
78.12:
He performed wonders before their fathers
In the land of Egypt, in the field of Zoan.
78.13:
He divided the sea and caused them to pass through,
And He made the waters stand up like a heap.
78.14:
Then He led them with the cloud by day
And all the night with a light of fire.
78.15:
He split the rocks in the wilderness
And gave them plenty to drink like the ocean depths.
78.16:
He brought forth streams from the rock
And made waters run down like rivers.
78.17:
Yet they still continued to sin against Him,
To rebel against the Most High in the desert.
78.18:
And in their heart they put God to the test
By asking for food that suited their taste.
78.19:
Then they spoke against God;
They said, “Can God prepare a table in the wilderness?
78.20:
Behold, He struck the rock so that waters gushed out,
And streams were overflowing;
Can He also provide bread?
Will He prepare meat for His people?”
78.22:
Because they did not believe in God
And did not trust in His salvation.
78.23:
Yet He commanded the clouds above
And opened the doors of heaven;
78.24:
He rained down manna upon them to eat,
And gave them food from heaven.
78.25:
Man ate the bread of angels;
He sent them food in abundance.
78.26:
He made the east wind blow in the sky
And by His power He directed the south wind.
78.27:
When He rained meat upon them like the dust,
Even winged fowl like the sand of the seas,
78.28:
He let them fall in the midst of their camp,
All around their dwellings.
78.29:
So they ate and were well filled,
And He satisfied their longing.
78.30:
Yet before they had abandoned their longing,
While their food was in their mouths,
78.31:
The anger of God rose against them
And killed some of their strongest ones,
And subdued the choice men of Israel.
78.32:
In spite of all this they still sinned
And did not believe in His wonderful works.
78.33:
So He brought their days to an end in futility,
And their years to an end in sudden terror.
78.34:
When He killed them, then they sought Him,
And they returned and searched diligently for God;
78.35:
And they remembered that God was their rock,
And the Most High God their Redeemer.
78.36:
But they flattered Him with their mouth
And lied to Him with their tongue.
78.37:
For their heart was not steadfast toward Him,
Nor were they faithful with His covenant.
78.39:
So He remembered that they were only flesh,
A wind that passes and does not return.
78.40:
How often they rebelled against Him in the wilderness
And grieved Him in the desert!
78.41:
Again and again they tempted God,
And pained the Holy One of Israel.
78.42:
They did not remember His power,
The day when He redeemed them from the enemy,
78.43:
When He performed His signs in Egypt
And His marvels in the field of Zoan,
78.44:
And turned their rivers to blood,
And their streams, so that they could not drink.
78.45:
He sent swarms of flies among them that devoured them,
And frogs that destroyed them.
78.46:
He also gave their crops to the grasshopper
And the product of their labor to the locust.
78.47:
He destroyed their vines with hailstones
And their sycamore trees with frost.
78.48:
He also turned their cattle over to the hailstones,
And their herds to bolts of lightning.
78.49:
He sent His burning anger upon them,
Fury and indignation and trouble,
A band of destroying angels.
78.51:
And struck all the firstborn in Egypt,
The first and best of their vigor in the tents of Ham.
78.52:
But He led His own people out like sheep,
And guided them in the wilderness like a flock;
78.53:
He led them safely, so that they did not fear;
But the sea engulfed their enemies.
78.54:
So He brought them to His holy land,
To this hill country which His right hand had gained.
78.55:
He also drove out the nations from them
And apportioned them as an inheritance by measurement,
And had the tribes of Israel dwell in their tents.
78.56:
Yet they tempted and rebelled against the Most High God
And did not keep His testimonies,
78.57:
But turned back and acted treacherously like their fathers;
They turned aside like a treacherous bow.
78.58:
For they provoked Him with their high places
And moved Him to jealousy with their carved images.
78.59:
When God heard them, He was filled with wrath
And He utterly rejected Israel;
78.60:
So that He abandoned the dwelling place at Shiloh,
The tent which He had pitched among people,
78.61:
And He gave up His strength to captivity
And His glory into the hand of the enemy.
78.62:
He also turned His people over to the sword,
And was filled with wrath at His inheritance.
78.63:
Fire devoured His young men,
And His virgins had no wedding songs.
78.64:
His priests fell by the sword,
And His widows could not weep.
78.65:
Then the Lord awoke as if from sleep,
Like a warrior overcome by wine.
78.66:
He drove His adversaries backward;
He put on them an everlasting disgrace.
78.67:
He also rejected the tent of Joseph,
And did not choose the tribe of Ephraim,
78.68:
But chose the tribe of Judah,
Mount Zion, which He loved.
78.69:
And He built His sanctuary like the heights,
Like the earth which He has established forever.
78.70:
He also chose His servant David
And took him from the sheepfolds;
78.71:
From the care of the ewes with nursing lambs He brought him
To shepherd Jacob His people,
And Israel His inheritance.
78.72:
So he shepherded them according to the integrity of his heart,
And guided them with his skillful hands.

79.2:
They have given the dead bodies of Your servants to the birds of the sky as food,
The flesh of Your godly ones to the animals of the earth.
79.3:
They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem;
And there was no one to bury them.
79.4:
We have become a disgrace before our neighbors,
An object of derision and ridicule to those around us.
79.5:
How long, Lord? Will You be angry forever?
Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
79.6:
Pour out Your wrath upon the nations which do not know You,
And upon the kingdoms which do not call upon Your name.
79.7:
For they have devoured Jacob
And laid waste his settlement.
79.9:
Help us, God of our salvation, for the glory of Your name;
And save us and forgive our sins for the sake of Your name.
79.10:
Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”
Let vengeance for the blood of Your servants which has been shed
Be known among the nations in our sight.
79.11:
Let the groaning of the prisoner come before You;
According to the greatness of Your power, let those who are doomed to die remain.
79.12:
And return to our neighbors seven times as much into their lap
Their taunts with which they have taunted You, Lord.

80.2:
Before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, awaken Your power,
And come to save us!
80.3:
God, restore us
And make Your face shine upon us, and we will be saved.
80.4:
Lord God of armies,
How long will You be angry with the prayer of Your people?
80.5:
You have fed them with the bread of tears,
And You have made them drink tears in large measure.
80.6:
You make us an object of contention to our neighbors,
And our enemies laugh among themselves.
80.7:
God of armies, restore us
And make Your face shine upon us, and we will be saved.
80.8:
You removed a vine from Egypt;
You drove out the nations and planted it.
80.9:
You cleared the ground before it,
And it took deep root and filled the land.
80.10:
The mountains were covered with its shadow,
And the cedars of God with its branches.
80.11:
It was sending out its branches to the sea
And its shoots to the Euphrates River.
80.12:
Why have You broken down its hedges,
So that all who pass that way pick its fruit?
80.13:
A boar from the forest eats it away,
And whatever moves in the field feeds on it.
80.14:
God of armies, do turn back;
Look down from heaven and see, and take care of this vine,
80.15:
The shoot which Your right hand has planted,
And of the son whom You have strengthened for Yourself.
80.16:
It is burned with fire, it is cut down;
They perish from the rebuke of Your face.
80.17:
Let Your hand be upon the man of Your right hand,
Upon the son of man whom You made strong for Yourself.
80.18:
Then we will not turn back from You;
Revive us, and we will call upon Your name.
80.19:
Lord God of armies, restore us;
Make Your face shine upon us, and we will be saved.

81.1:
Sing for joy to God our strength;
Shout joyfully to the God of Jacob.
81.2:
Raise a song, strike the tambourine,
The sweet sounding lyre with the harp.
81.3:
Blow the trumpet at the new moon,
At the full moon, on our feast day.
81.4:
For it is a statute for Israel,
An ordinance of the God of Jacob.
81.5:
He established it as a testimony in Joseph
When he went throughout the land of Egypt.
I heard a language I did not know:
81.6:
“I relieved his shoulder of the burden,
His hands were freed from the basket.
81.8:
Hear, My people, and I will admonish you;
Israel, if you would listen to Me!
81.9:
There shall be no strange god among you;
Nor shall you worship a foreign god.
81.11:
“But My people did not listen to My voice,
And Israel did not obey Me.
81.12:
So I gave them over to the stubbornness of their heart,
To walk by their own plans.
81.13:
Oh that My people would listen to Me,
That Israel would walk in My ways!
81.14:
I would quickly subdue their enemies
And turn My hand against their adversaries.
81.15:
Those who hate the Lord would pretend to obey Him,
And their time of punishment would be forever.
81.16:
But I would feed you with the finest of the wheat,
And with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.”

82.1:
God takes His position in His assembly;
He judges in the midst of the gods.
82.2:
How long will you judge unjustly
And show partiality to the wicked? Selah
82.3:
Vindicate the weak and fatherless;
Do justice to the afflicted and destitute.
82.4:
Rescue the weak and needy;
Save them from the hand of the wicked.
82.6:
I said, “You are gods,
And all of you are sons of the Most High.
82.7:
Nevertheless you will die like men,
And fall like one of the princes.”
82.8:
Arise, God, judge the earth!
For You possess all the nations.

83.1:
God, do not remain quiet;
Do not be silent and, God, do not be still.
83.2:
For behold, Your enemies make an uproar,
And those who hate You have exalted themselves.
83.3:
They make shrewd plans against Your people,
And conspire together against Your treasured ones.
83.4:
They have said, “Come, and let’s wipe them out as a nation,
So that the name of Israel will no longer be remembered.”
83.5:
For they have conspired together with one mind;
They make a covenant against You:
83.6:
The tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
Moab and the Hagrites;
83.7:
Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek,
Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;
83.8:
Assyria also has joined them;
They have become a help to the children of Lot. Selah
83.9:
Deal with them as with Midian,
As with Sisera and Jabin at the river of Kishon,
83.10:
Who were destroyed at En-dor,
Who became like dung for the ground.
83.11:
Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,
And all their leaders like Zebah and Zalmunna,
83.12:
Who said, “Let’s possess for ourselves
The pastures of God.”
83.13:
My God, make them like the whirling dust,
Like chaff before the wind.
83.14:
Like fire that burns the forest,
And like a flame that sets the mountains on fire,
83.15:
So pursue them with Your heavy gale,
And terrify them with Your storm.
83.16:
Fill their faces with dishonor,
So that they will seek Your name, Lord.
83.17:
May they be ashamed and dismayed forever,
And may they be humiliated and perish,
83.18:
So that they will know that You alone, whose name is the Lord,
Are the Most High over all the earth.

84.1:
How lovely are Your dwelling places,
Lord of armies!
84.2:
My soul longed and even yearned for the courtyards of the Lord;
My heart and my flesh sing for joy to the living God.
84.3:
The bird also has found a house,
And the swallow a nest for herself, where she may put her young:
Your altars, Lord of armies,
My King and my God.
84.4:
Blessed are those who dwell in Your house!
They are ever praising You. Selah
84.5:
Blessed is the person whose strength is in You,
In whose heart are the roads to Zion!
84.6:
Passing through the Valley of Baca they make it a spring;
The early rain also covers it with blessings.
84.7:
They go from strength to strength,
Every one of them appears before God in Zion.
84.8:
Lord God of armies, hear my prayer;
Listen, God of Jacob! Selah
84.9:
See our shield, God,
And look at the face of Your anointed.
84.10:
For a day in Your courtyards is better than a thousand elsewhere.
I would rather stand at the threshold of the house of my God
Than live in the tents of wickedness.
84.12:
Lord of armies,
Blessed is the person who trusts in You!

85.1:
Lord, You showed favor to Your land;
You restored the fortunes of Jacob.
85.2:
You forgave the guilt of Your people;
You covered all their sin. Selah
85.3:
You withdrew all Your fury;
You turned away from Your burning anger.
85.4:
Restore us, God of our salvation,
And cause Your indignation toward us to cease.
85.5:
Will You be angry with us forever?
Will You prolong Your anger to all generations?
85.6:
Will You not revive us again,
So that Your people may rejoice in You?
85.7:
Show us Your mercy, Lord,
And grant us Your salvation.
85.9:
Certainly His salvation is near to those who fear Him,
That glory may dwell in our land.
85.10:
Graciousness and truth have met together;
Righteousness and peace have kissed each other.
85.11:
Truth sprouts from the earth,
And righteousness looks down from heaven.
85.12:
Indeed, the Lord will give what is good,
And our land will yield its produce.
85.13:
Righteousness will go before Him
And will make His footsteps into a way.

86.1:
Incline Your ear, Lord, and answer me;
For I am afflicted and needy.
86.2:
Protect my soul, for I am godly;
You my God, save Your servant who trusts in You.
86.3:
Be gracious to me, Lord,
For I call upon You all day long.
86.4:
Make the soul of Your servant joyful,
For to You, Lord, I lift up my soul.
86.5:
For You, Lord, are good, and ready to forgive,
And abundant in mercy to all who call upon You.
86.6:
Listen, Lord, to my prayer;
And give Your attention to the sound of my pleading!
86.7:
On the day of my trouble I will call upon You,
For You will answer me.
86.8:
There is no one like You among the gods, Lord,
Nor are there any works like Yours.
86.9:
All nations whom You have made will come and worship before You, Lord,
And they will glorify Your name.
86.10:
For You are great, and You do wondrous deeds;
You alone are God.
86.12:
I will give thanks to You, Lord my God, with all my heart,
And I will glorify Your name forever.
86.13:
For Your graciousness toward me is great,
And You have saved my soul from the depths of Sheol.
86.14:
God, arrogant men have risen up against me,
And a gang of violent men have sought my life,
And they have not set You before them.
86.15:
But You, Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God,
Slow to anger and abundant in mercy and truth.
86.17:
Show me a sign of good,
That those who hate me may see it and be ashamed,
Because You, Lord, have helped me and comforted me.

87.1: His foundation is in the holy mountains.
87.2:
The Lord loves the gates of Zion
More than all the other dwelling places of Jacob.
87.3:
Glorious things are spoken of you,
City of God. Selah
87.5:
But of Zion it will be said, “This one and that one were born in her”;
And the Most High Himself will establish her.
87.6:
The Lord will count when He registers the peoples,
“This one was born there.” Selah
87.7:
Then those who sing as well as those who play the flutes will say,
“All my springs of joy are in you.”

88.1:
Lord, the God of my salvation,
I have cried out by day and in the night before You.
88.2:
Let my prayer come before You;
Incline Your ear to my cry!
88.3:
For my soul has had enough troubles,
And my life has approached Sheol.
88.4:
I am counted among those who go down to the pit;
I have become like a man without strength,
88.5:
Abandoned among the dead,
Like the slain who lie in the grave,
Whom You no longer remember,
And they are cut off from Your hand.
88.6:
You have put me in the lowest pit,
In dark places, in the depths.
88.7:
Your wrath has rested upon me,
And You have afflicted me with all Your waves. Selah
88.10:
Will You perform wonders for the dead?
Or will the departed spirits rise and praise You? Selah
88.11:
Will Your graciousness be declared in the grave,
Your faithfulness in Abaddon?
88.12:
Will Your wonders be made known in the darkness?
And Your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
88.13:
But I, Lord, have cried out to You for help,
And in the morning my prayer comes before You.
88.14:
Lord, why do You reject my soul?
Why do You hide Your face from me?
88.15:
I was miserable and about to die from my youth on;
I suffer Your terrors; I grow weary.
88.16:
Your burning anger has passed over me;
Your terrors have destroyed me.
88.17:
They have surrounded me like water all day long;
They have encircled me altogether.
88.18:
You have removed lover and friend far from me;
My acquaintances are in a hiding place.

89.1:
I will sing of the graciousness of the Lord forever;
To all generations I will make Your faithfulness known with my mouth.
89.2:
For I have said, “Graciousness will be built up forever;
In the heavens You will establish Your faithfulness.”
89.3:
“I have made a covenant with My chosen;
I have sworn to My servant David,
89.4:
I will establish your descendants forever
And build up your throne to all generations.” Selah
89.5:
The heavens will praise Your wonders, Lord;
Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.
89.6:
For who in the skies is comparable to the Lord?
Who among the sons of the mighty is like the Lord,
89.7:
A God greatly feared in the council of the holy ones,
And awesome above all those who are around Him?
89.8:
Lord God of armies, who is like You, mighty Lord?
Your faithfulness also surrounds You.
89.9:
You rule the surging of the sea;
When its waves rise, You calm them.
89.10:
You Yourself crushed Rahab like one who is slain;
You scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm.
89.11:
The heavens are Yours, the earth also is Yours;
The world and all it contains, You have established them.
89.12:
The north and the south, You have created them;
Tabor and Hermon shout for joy at Your name.
89.13:
You have a strong arm;
Your hand is mighty, Your right hand is exalted.
89.14:
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne;
Mercy and truth go before You.
89.15:
Blessed are the people who know the joyful sound!
Lord, they walk in the light of Your face.
89.16:
In Your name they rejoice all the day,
And by Your righteousness they are exalted.
89.17:
For You are the glory of their strength,
And by Your favor our horn is exalted.
89.18:
For our shield belongs to the Lord,
And our king to the Holy One of Israel.
89.20:
I have found My servant David;
With My holy oil I have anointed him,
89.21:
With whom My hand will be established;
My arm also will strengthen him.
89.22:
The enemy will not deceive him,
Nor will the son of wickedness afflict him.
89.23:
But I will crush his adversaries before him,
And strike those who hate him.
89.24:
My faithfulness and My favor will be with him,
And in My name his horn will be exalted.
89.25:
I will also place his hand on the sea,
And his right hand on the rivers.
89.26:
He will call to Me, ‘You are my Father,
My God, and the rock of my salvation.’
89.27:
I will also make him My firstborn,
The highest of the kings of the earth.
89.28:
I will maintain My favor for him forever,
And My covenant shall be confirmed to him.
89.29:
So I will establish his descendants forever,
And his throne as the days of heaven.
89.30:
“If his sons abandon My Law
And do not walk in My judgments,
89.31:
If they violate My statutes
And do not keep My commandments,
89.32:
Then I will punish their wrongdoing with the rod,
And their guilt with afflictions.
89.33:
But I will not withhold My favor from him,
Nor deal falsely in My faithfulness.
89.34:
I will not violate My covenant,
Nor will I alter the utterance of My lips.
89.35:
Once I have sworn by My holiness;
I will not lie to David.
89.36:
His descendants shall endure forever,
And his throne as the sun before Me.
89.37:
It shall be established forever like the moon,
And a witness in the sky is faithful.” Selah
89.38:
But You have rejected and refused,
You have been full of wrath against Your anointed.
89.39:
You have repudiated the covenant of Your servant;
You have profaned his crown in the dust.
89.40:
You have broken down all his walls;
You have brought his strongholds to ruin.
89.41:
All who pass along the way plunder him;
He has become a disgrace to his neighbors.
89.42:
You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries;
You have made all his enemies rejoice.
89.43:
You also turn back the edge of his sword,
And have not made him stand in battle.
89.44:
You have put an end to his splendor
And cast his throne to the ground.
89.45:
You have shortened the days of his youth;
You have covered him with shame. Selah
89.46:
How long, Lord?
Will You hide Yourself forever?
Will Your wrath burn like fire?
89.47:
Remember what my lifespan is;
For what futility You have created all the sons of mankind!
89.48:
What man can live and not see death?
Can he save his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah
89.49:
Where are Your former acts of favor, Lord,
Which You swore to David in Your faithfulness?
89.50:
Remember, Lord, the taunt against Your servants;
How I carry in my heart the taunts of all the many peoples,
89.51:
With which Your enemies have taunted, Lord,
With which they have taunted the footsteps of Your anointed.
89.52:
Blessed be the Lord forever!
Amen and Amen.

90.1: Lord, You have been our dwelling place in all generations.
90.2:
Before the mountains were born
Or You gave birth to the earth and the world,
Even from everlasting to everlasting, You are God.
90.3:
You turn mortals back into dust
And say, “Return, you sons of mankind.”
90.4:
For a thousand years in Your sight
Are like yesterday when it passes by,
Or like a watch in the night.
90.5:
You have swept them away like a flood, they fall asleep;
In the morning they are like grass that sprouts anew.
90.6:
In the morning it flourishes and sprouts anew;
Toward evening it wilts and withers away.
90.7:
For we have been consumed by Your anger,
And we have been terrified by Your wrath.
90.8:
You have placed our guilty deeds before You,
Our hidden sins in the light of Your presence.
90.9:
For all our days have dwindled away in Your fury;
We have finished our years like a sigh.
90.10:
As for the days of our life, they contain seventy years,
Or if due to strength, eighty years,
Yet their pride is only trouble and tragedy;
For it quickly passes, and we disappear.
90.11:
Who understands the power of Your anger
And Your fury, according to the fear that is due You?
90.12:
So teach us to number our days,
That we may present to You a heart of wisdom.
90.13:
Do return, Lord; how long will it be?
And be sorry for Your servants.
90.14:
Satisfy us in the morning with Your graciousness,
That we may sing for joy and rejoice all our days.
90.15:
Make us glad according to the days You have afflicted us,
And the years we have seen evil.
90.16:
Let Your work appear to Your servants
And Your majesty to their children.

91.1:
One who dwells in the shelter of the Most High
Will lodge in the shadow of the Almighty.
91.2:
I will say to the Lord, “My refuge and my fortress,
My God, in whom I trust!”
91.3:
For it is He who rescues you from the net of the trapper
And from the deadly plague.
91.5:
You will not be afraid of the terror by night,
Or of the arrow that flies by day;
91.6:
Of the plague that stalks in darkness,
Or of the destruction that devastates at noon.
91.7:
A thousand may fall at your side
And ten thousand at your right hand,
But it shall not approach you.
91.8:
You will only look on with your eyes
And see the retaliation against the wicked.
91.9:
For you have made the Lord, my refuge,
The Most High, your dwelling place.
91.10:
No evil will happen to you,
Nor will any plague come near your tent.
91.11:
For He will give His angels orders concerning you,
To protect you in all your ways.
91.12:
On their hands they will lift you up,
So that you do not strike your foot against a stone.
91.13:
You will walk upon the lion and cobra,
You will trample the young lion and the serpent.
91.14:
“Because he has loved Me, I will save him;
I will set him securely on high, because he has known My name.
91.16:
I will satisfy him with a long life,
And show him My salvation.”

92.1:
It is good to give thanks to the Lord
And to sing praises to Your name, Most High;
92.2:
To declare Your goodness in the morning
And Your faithfulness by night,
92.3:
With the ten-stringed lute and with the harp,
With resounding music on the lyre.
92.4:
For You, Lord, have made me joyful by what You have done,
I will sing for joy over the works of Your hands.
92.5:
How great are Your works, Lord!
Your thoughts are very deep.
92.6:
A stupid person has no knowledge,
Nor does a foolish person understand this:
92.7:
When the wicked sprouted up like grass
And all who did injustice flourished,
It was only that they might be destroyed forevermore.
92.8: But You, Lord, are on high forever.
92.10:
But You have exalted my horn like that of the wild ox;
I have been anointed with fresh oil.
92.11:
And my eye has looked at my enemies,
My ears hear of the evildoers who rise up against me.
92.12:
The righteous person will flourish like the palm tree,
He will grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
92.13:
Planted in the house of the Lord,
They will flourish in the courtyards of our God.
92.14:
They will still yield fruit in advanced age;
They will be full of sap and very green,
92.15:
To declare that the Lord is just;
He is my rock, and there is no malice in Him.

93.2:
Your throne is established from of old;
You are from eternity.
93.3:
The floods have lifted up, Lord,
The floods have lifted up their voice,
The floods lift up their pounding waves.
93.4:
More than the sounds of many waters,
Than the mighty breakers of the sea,
The Lord on high is mighty.

94.1:
Lord, God of vengeance,
God of vengeance, shine forth!
94.2:
Rise up, Judge of the earth,
Pay back retribution to the proud.
94.3:
How long, Lord, shall the wicked—
How long shall the wicked triumph?
94.4:
They pour out words, they speak arrogantly;
All who do injustice boast.
94.5:
They crush Your people, Lord,
And afflict Your inheritance.
94.6:
They kill the widow and the stranger
And murder the orphans.
94.7:
They have said, “The Lord does not see,
Nor does the God of Jacob perceive.”
94.8:
Pay attention, you stupid ones among the people;
And when will you understand, foolish ones?
94.9:
He who planted the ear, does He not hear?
Or He who formed the eye, does He not see?
94.10:
He who disciplines the nations, will He not rebuke,
He who teaches mankind knowledge?
94.11:
The Lord knows human thoughts,
That they are mere breath.
94.12:
Blessed is the man whom You discipline, Lord,
And whom You teach from Your Law,
94.13:
So that You may grant him relief from the days of adversity,
Until a pit is dug for the wicked.
94.14:
For the Lord will not abandon His people,
Nor will He abandon His inheritance.
94.15:
For judgment will again be righteous,
And all the upright in heart will follow it.
94.16:
Who will stand up for me against evildoers?
Who will take his stand for me against those who do injustice?
94.17:
If the Lord had not been my help,
My soul would soon have dwelt in the land of silence.
94.18:
If I should say, “My foot has slipped,”
Your faithfulness, Lord, will support me.
94.19:
When my anxious thoughts multiply within me,
Your comfort delights my soul.
94.20:
Can a throne of destruction be allied with You,
One which devises mischief by decree?
94.21:
They band themselves together against the life of the righteous
And condemn the innocent to death.
94.22:
But the Lord has been my refuge,
And my God the rock of my refuge.

95.1:
Come, let’s sing for joy to the Lord,
Let’s shout joyfully to the rock of our salvation.
95.2:
Let’s come before His presence with a song of thanksgiving,
Let’s shout joyfully to Him in songs with instruments.
95.3:
For the Lord is a great God
And a great King above all gods,
95.4:
In whose hand are the depths of the earth,
The peaks of the mountains are also His.
95.5:
The sea is His, for it was He who made it,
And His hands formed the dry land.
95.6:
Come, let’s worship and bow down,
Let’s kneel before the Lord our Maker.
95.7:
For He is our God,
And we are the people of His pasture and the sheep of His hand.
Today, if you will hear His voice,
95.8:
Do not harden your hearts as at Meribah,
As on the day of Massah in the wilderness,
95.9:
“When your fathers put Me to the test,
They tested Me, though they had seen My work.
95.10:
For forty years I was disgusted with that generation,
And said they are a people who err in their heart,
And they do not know My ways.
95.11:
Therefore I swore in My anger,
They certainly shall not enter My rest.”

96.1:
Sing to the Lord a new song;
Sing to the Lord, all the earth.
96.2:
Sing to the Lord, bless His name;
Proclaim the good news of His salvation from day to day.
96.3:
Tell of His glory among the nations,
His wonderful deeds among all the peoples.
96.4:
For great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised;
He is to be feared above all gods.
96.5:
For all the gods of the peoples are idols,
But the Lord made the heavens.
96.6:
Splendor and majesty are before Him,
Strength and beauty are in His sanctuary.
96.7:
Ascribe to the Lord, you families of the peoples,
Ascribe to the Lord glory and strength.
96.8:
Ascribe to the Lord the glory of His name;
Bring an offering and come into His courtyards.
96.9:
Worship the Lord in holy attire;
Tremble before Him, all the earth.
96.11:
May the heavens be joyful, and may the earth rejoice;
May the sea roar, and all it contains;
96.12:
May the field be jubilant, and all that is in it.
Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy
96.13:
Before the Lord, for He is coming,
For He is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world in righteousness,
And the peoples in His faithfulness.

97.1:
The Lord reigns, may the earth rejoice;
May the many islands be joyful.
97.2:
Clouds and thick darkness surround Him;
Righteousness and justice are the foundation of His throne.
97.3:
Fire goes before Him
And burns up His enemies all around.
97.4:
His lightning lit up the world;
The earth saw it and trembled.
97.5:
The mountains melted like wax at the presence of the Lord,
At the presence of the Lord of the whole earth.
97.6:
The heavens declare His righteousness,
And all the peoples have seen His glory.
97.8:
Zion heard this and was joyful,
And the daughters of Judah have rejoiced
Because of Your judgments, Lord.
97.9:
For You are the Lord Most High over all the earth;
You are exalted far above all gods.
97.11:
Light is sown like seed for the righteous,
And gladness for the upright in heart.
97.12:
Be joyful in the Lord, you righteous ones,
And praise the mention of His holy name.

98.1:
Sing a new song to the Lord,
For He has done wonderful things,
His right hand and His holy arm have gained the victory for Him.
98.2:
The Lord has made His salvation known;
He has revealed His righteousness in the sight of the nations.
98.3:
He has remembered His graciousness and His faithfulness to the house of Israel;
All the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
98.4:
Shout joyfully to the Lord, all the earth;
Be cheerful and sing for joy and sing praises.
98.5:
Sing praises to the Lord with the lyre,
With the lyre and the sound of melody.
98.6:
With trumpets and the sound of the horn
Shout joyfully before the King, the Lord.
98.7:
May the sea roar and all it contains,
The world and those who dwell in it.
98.8:
May the rivers clap their hands,
May the mountains sing together for joy

99.1:
The Lord reigns, the peoples tremble!
He sits enthroned above the cherubim, the earth quakes!
99.2:
The Lord is great in Zion,
And He is exalted above all the peoples.
99.3:
May they praise Your great and awesome name;
Holy is He.
99.9:
Exalt the Lord our God
And worship at His holy hill,
For the Lord our God is holy.

100.1: Shout joyfully to the Lord, all the earth.
100.2:
Serve the Lord with jubilation;
Come before Him with rejoicing.
100.4:
Enter His gates with thanksgiving,
And His courtyards with praise.
Give thanks to Him, bless His name.

101.1:
I will sing of mercy and justice;
To You, Lord, I will sing praises.
101.2:
I will carefully attend to the blameless way.
When will You come to me?
I will walk within my house in the integrity of my heart.
101.4:
A perverse heart shall leave me;
I will know no evil.
101.5:
Whoever secretly slanders his neighbor, him I will destroy;
I will not endure one who has a haughty look and an arrogant heart.
101.6:
My eyes shall be upon the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me;
One who walks in a blameless way is one who will serve me.
101.7:
One who practices deceit shall not dwell within my house;
One who speaks lies shall not maintain his position before me.
101.8:
Every morning I will destroy all the wicked of the land,
So as to eliminate from the city of the Lord all those who do injustice.

102.1:
Hear my prayer, Lord!
And let my cry for help come to You.
102.3:
For my days have ended in smoke,
And my bones have been scorched like a hearth.
102.4:
My heart has been struck like grass and has withered,
Indeed, I forget to eat my bread.
102.5:
Because of the loudness of my groaning
My bones cling to my flesh.
102.6:
I resemble a pelican of the wilderness;
I have become like an owl of the ruins.
102.7:
I lie awake,
I have become like a solitary bird on a housetop.
102.8:
My enemies have taunted me all day long;
Those who deride me have used my name as a curse.
102.9:
For I have eaten ashes like bread,
And mixed my drink with weeping
102.10:
Because of Your indignation and Your wrath;
For You have lifted me up and thrown me away.
102.11:
My days are like a lengthened shadow,
And I wither away like grass.
102.12:
But You, Lord, remain forever,
And Your name remains to all generations.
102.14:
Surely Your servants take pleasure in her stones,
And feel pity for her dust.
102.15:
So the nations will fear the name of the Lord,
And all the kings of the earth, Your glory.
102.16:
For the Lord has built up Zion;
He has appeared in His glory.
102.17:
He has turned His attention to the prayer of the destitute
And has not despised their prayer.
102.18:
This will be written for the generation to come,
That a people yet to be created may praise the Lord:
102.19:
For He looked down from His holy height;
From heaven the Lord looked upon the earth,
102.20:
To hear the groaning of the prisoner,
To set free those who were doomed to death,
102.21:
So that people may tell of the name of the Lord in Zion,
And His praise in Jerusalem,
102.22:
When the peoples are gathered together,
And the kingdoms, to serve the Lord.
102.23:
He has broken my strength in the way;
He has shortened my days.
102.24:
I say, “My God, do not take me away in the middle of my days,
Your years are throughout all generations.
102.25:
In time of old You founded the earth,
And the heavens are the work of Your hands.
102.27:
But You are the same,
And Your years will not come to an end.
102.28:
The children of Your servants will continue,
And their descendants will be established before You.”

103.1:
Bless the Lord, my soul,
And all that is within me, bless His holy name.
103.2:
Bless the Lord, my soul,
And do not forget any of His benefits;
103.3:
Who pardons all your guilt,
Who heals all your diseases;
103.4:
Who redeems your life from the pit,
Who crowns you with favor and compassion;
103.5:
Who satisfies your years with good things,
So that your youth is renewed like the eagle.
103.6:
The Lord performs righteous deeds
And judgments for all who are oppressed.
103.7:
He made known His ways to Moses,
His deeds to the sons of Israel.
103.8:
The Lord is compassionate and gracious,
Slow to anger and abounding in mercy.
103.9:
He will not always contend with us,
Nor will He keep His anger forever.
103.10:
He has not dealt with us according to our sins,
Nor rewarded us according to our guilty deeds.
103.11:
For as high as the heavens are above the earth,
So great is His mercy toward those who fear Him.
103.12:
As far as the east is from the west,
So far has He removed our wrongdoings from us.
103.13:
Just as a father has compassion on his children,
So the Lord has compassion on those who fear Him.
103.14:
For He Himself knows our form;
He is mindful that we are nothing but dust.
103.15:
As for man, his days are like grass;
Like a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
103.16:
When the wind has passed over it, it is no more,
And its place no longer knows about it.
103.17:
But the mercy of the Lord is from everlasting to everlasting for those who fear Him,
And His justice to the children’s children,
103.18:
To those who keep His covenant
And remember His precepts, so as to do them.
103.19:
The Lord has established His throne in the heavens,
And His sovereignty rules over all.
103.20:
Bless the Lord, you His angels,
Mighty in strength, who perform His word,
Obeying the voice of His word!
103.21:
Bless the Lord, all you His angels,
You who serve Him, doing His will.

104.2:
Covering Yourself with light as with a cloak,
Stretching out heaven like a tent curtain.
104.4:
He makes the winds His messengers,
Flaming fire His ministers.
104.5:
He established the earth upon its foundations,
So that it will not totter forever and ever.
104.6:
You covered it with the deep sea as with a garment;
The waters were standing above the mountains.
104.7:
They fled from Your rebuke,
At the sound of Your thunder they hurried away.
104.8:
The mountains rose; the valleys sank down
To the place which You established for them.
104.9:
You set a boundary so that they will not pass over,
So that they will not return to cover the earth.
104.10:
He sends forth springs in the valleys;
They flow between the mountains;
104.11:
They give drink to every animal of the field;
The wild donkeys quench their thirst.
104.12:
The birds of the sky dwell beside them;
They lift up their voices from among the branches.
104.13:
He waters the mountains from His upper chambers;
The earth is satisfied with the fruit of His works.
104.14:
He causes the grass to grow for the cattle,
And vegetation for the labor of mankind,
So that they may produce food from the earth,
104.15:
And wine, which makes a human heart cheerful,
So that he makes his face gleam with oil,
And food, which sustains a human heart.
104.16:
The trees of the Lord drink their fill,
The cedars of Lebanon which He planted,
104.17:
Where the birds build their nests,
And the stork, whose home is the juniper trees.
104.18:
The high mountains are for the wild goats;
The cliffs are a refuge for the rock hyrax.
104.19:
He made the moon for the seasons;
The sun knows the place of its setting.
104.20:
You appoint darkness and it becomes night,
In which all the animals of the forest prowl about.
104.21:
The young lions roar for their prey
And seek their food from God.
104.22:
When the sun rises they withdraw,
And they lie down in their dens.
104.23:
A person goes out to his work
And to his labor until evening.
104.25:
There is the sea, great and broad,
In which are swarms without number,
Animals both small and great.
104.26:
The ships move along there,
And Leviathan, which You have formed to have fun in it.
104.27:
They all wait for You
To give them their food in due season.
104.28:
You give to them, they gather it up;
You open Your hand, they are satisfied with good.
104.30:
You send forth Your Spirit, they are created;
And You renew the face of the ground.
104.31:
May the glory of the Lord endure forever;
May the Lord rejoice in His works;
104.32:
He looks at the earth, and it trembles;
He touches the mountains, and they smoke.
104.33:
I will sing to the Lord as long as I live;
I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
104.34:
May my praise be pleasing to Him;
As for me, I shall rejoice in the Lord.
104.35:
May sinners be removed from the earth
And may the wicked be no more.
Bless the Lord, my soul.
Praise the Lord!

105.1:
Give thanks to the Lord, call upon His name;
Make His deeds known among the peoples.
105.2:
Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
Tell of all His wonders.
105.3:
Boast in His holy name;
May the heart of those who seek the Lord be joyful.
105.4:
Seek the Lord and His strength;
Seek His face continually.
105.5:
Remember His wonders which He has done,
His marvels and the judgments spoken by His mouth,
105.6:
You descendants of Abraham, His servant,
You sons of Jacob, His chosen ones!
105.7:
He is the Lord our God;
His judgments are in all the earth.
105.8:
He has remembered His covenant forever,
The word which He commanded to a thousand generations,
105.9:
The covenant which He made with Abraham,
And His oath to Isaac.
105.10:
Then He confirmed it to Jacob as a statute,
To Israel as an everlasting covenant,
105.11:
Saying, “To you I will give the land of Canaan
As the portion of your inheritance,”
105.12:
When they were only a few people in number,
Very few, and strangers in it.
105.13:
And they wandered from nation to nation,
From one kingdom to another people,
105.14:
He allowed no one to oppress them,
And He rebuked kings for their sakes, saying,
105.15:
“Do not touch My anointed ones,
And do not harm My prophets.”
105.16:
And He called for a famine upon the land;
He broke the whole staff of bread.
105.17:
He sent a man before them,
Joseph, who was sold as a slave.
105.18:
They forced his feet into shackles,
He was put in irons;
105.19:
Until the time that his word came to pass,
The word of the Lord refined him.
105.20:
The king sent and released him,
The ruler of peoples, and set him free.
105.21:
He made him lord of his house,
And ruler over all his possessions,
105.22:
To imprison his high officials at will,
That he might teach his elders wisdom.
105.23:
Israel also came into Egypt;
So Jacob lived in the land of Ham.
105.24:
And He made His people very fruitful,
And made them stronger than their enemies.
105.25:
He turned their heart to hate His people,
To deal cunningly with His servants.
105.26:
He sent His servant Moses,
And Aaron, whom He had chosen.
105.27:
They performed His wondrous acts among them,
And miracles in the land of Ham.
105.28:
He sent darkness and made it dark;
And they did not rebel against His words.
105.29:
He turned their waters into blood,
And caused their fish to die.
105.30:
Their land swarmed with frogs
Even in the chambers of their kings.
105.31:
He spoke, and a swarm of flies
And gnats invaded all their territory.
105.32:
He gave them hail for rain,
And flaming fire in their land.
105.33:
He also struck their vines and their fig trees,
And smashed the trees of their territory.
105.34:
He spoke, and locusts came,
And creeping locusts, beyond number,
105.35:
And they ate all the vegetation in their land,
And ate the fruit of their ground.
105.36:
He also fatally struck all the firstborn in their land,
The first fruits of all their vigor.
105.37:
Then He brought the Israelites out with silver and gold,
And among His tribes there was not one who stumbled.
105.38:
Egypt was glad when they departed,
For the dread of them had fallen upon the Egyptians.
105.39:
He spread out a cloud as a covering,
And fire to illumine by night.
105.40:
They asked, and He brought quail,
And satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
105.41:
He opened the rock and water flowed out;
It ran in the dry places like a river.
105.42:
For He remembered His holy word
With His servant Abraham;
105.43:
And He led out His people with joy,
His chosen ones with a joyful shout.
105.44:
He also gave them the lands of the nations,
So that they might take possession of the fruit of the peoples’ labor,

106.2:
Who can speak of the mighty deeds of the Lord,
Or can proclaim all His praise?
106.3:
How blessed are those who maintain justice,
Who practice righteousness at all times!
106.4:
Remember me, Lord, in Your favor toward Your people.
Visit me with Your salvation,
106.5:
So that I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones,
That I may rejoice in the joy of Your nation,
That I may boast with Your inheritance.
106.6:
We have sinned like our fathers,
We have gone astray, we have behaved wickedly.
106.8:
Nevertheless He saved them for the sake of His name,
So that He might make His power known.
106.9:
So He rebuked the Red Sea and it dried up,
And He led them through the mighty waters, as through the wilderness.
106.10:
So He saved them from the hand of one who hated them,
And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
106.11:
The waters covered their adversaries;
Not one of them was left.
106.12:
Then they believed His words;
They sang His praise.
106.13:
They quickly forgot His works;
They did not wait for His plan,
106.14:
But became lustfully greedy in the wilderness,
And put God to the test in the desert.
106.15:
So He gave them their request,
But sent a wasting disease among them.
106.16:
When they became envious of Moses in the camp,
And of Aaron, the holy one of the Lord,
106.17:
The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
And engulfed the company of Abiram.
106.18:
And a fire blazed up in their company;
The flame consumed the wicked.
106.19:
They made a calf in Horeb,
And worshiped a cast metal image.
106.20:
So they exchanged their glory
For the image of an ox that eats grass.
106.21:
They forgot God their Savior,
Who had done great things in Egypt,
106.22:
Wonders in the land of Ham,
And awesome things by the Red Sea.
106.23:
Therefore He said that He would destroy them,
If Moses, His chosen one, had not stood in the gap before Him,
To turn away His wrath from destroying them.
106.24:
Then they rejected the pleasant land;
They did not believe His word,
106.25:
But grumbled in their tents;
They did not listen to the voice of the Lord.
106.26:
Therefore He swore to them
That He would have them fall in the wilderness,
106.27:
And that He would bring down their descendants among the nations,
And scatter them in the lands.
106.28:
They also followed Baal-peor,
And ate sacrifices offered to the dead.
106.29:
So they provoked Him to anger with their deeds,
And a plague broke out among them.
106.30:
Then Phinehas stood up and intervened,
And so the plague was brought to a halt.
106.31:
And it was credited to him as righteousness,
To all generations forever.
106.32:
They also provoked Him to wrath at the waters of Meribah,
So that it went badly for Moses on their account.
106.33:
Because they were rebellious against His Spirit,
He spoke rashly with his lips.
106.34:
They did not destroy the peoples,
As the Lord had commanded them,
106.35:
But they got involved with the nations
And learned their practices,
106.36:
And served their idols,
Which became a snare to them.
106.37: They even sacrificed their sons and their daughters to the demons,
106.38:
And shed innocent blood,
The blood of their sons and their daughters
Whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan;
And the land was defiled with the blood.
106.39:
So they became unclean in their practices,
And were unfaithful in their deeds.
106.40:
Therefore the anger of the Lord was kindled against His people,
And He loathed His inheritance.
106.41:
So He handed them over to the nations,
And those who hated them ruled over them.
106.42:
Their enemies also oppressed them,
And they were subdued under their power.
106.44:
Nevertheless He looked at their distress
When He heard their cry;
106.45:
And He remembered His covenant for their sake,
And relented according to the greatness of His mercy.
106.46:
He also made them objects of compassion
In the presence of all their captors.
106.47:
Save us, Lord our God,
And gather us from the nations,
To give thanks to Your holy name
And glory in Your praise.
106.48:
Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel,
From everlasting to everlasting.
And all the people shall say, “Amen.”
Praise the Lord!

107.1:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good,
For His mercy is everlasting.
107.2:
The redeemed of the Lord shall say so,
Those whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy
107.3:
And gathered from the lands,
From the east and from the west,
From the north and from the south.
107.4:
They wandered in the wilderness in a desert region;
They did not find a way to an inhabited city.
107.5:
They were hungry and thirsty;
Their souls felt weak within them.
107.6:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them from their distresses.
107.7:
He also had them walk on a straight way,
To go to an inhabited city.
107.8:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
107.9:
For He has satisfied the thirsty soul,
And He has filled the hungry soul with what is good.
107.10:
There were those who lived in darkness and in the shadow of death,
Prisoners in misery and chains,
107.11:
Because they had rebelled against the words of God
And rejected the plan of the Most High.
107.12:
Therefore He humbled their heart with labor;
They stumbled and there was no one to help.
107.13:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them from their distresses.
107.14:
He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death
And broke their bands apart.
107.15:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
107.16:
For He has shattered gates of bronze
And cut off bars of iron.
107.17:
Fools, because of their rebellious way,
And because of their guilty deeds, were afflicted.
107.18:
Their souls loathed all kinds of food,
And they came close to the gates of death.
107.19:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble;
He saved them from their distresses.
107.20:
He sent His word and healed them,
And saved them from their destruction.
107.21:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
107.22:
They shall also offer sacrifices of thanksgiving,
And tell of His works with joyful singing.
107.23:
Those who go down to the sea in ships,
Who do business on great waters;
107.24:
They have seen the works of the Lord,
And His wonders in the deep.
107.25:
For He spoke and raised a stormy wind,
Which lifted the waves of the sea.
107.26:
They rose up to the heavens, they went down to the depths;
Their soul melted away in their misery.
107.27:
They reeled and staggered like a drunken person,
And were at their wits’ end.
107.28:
Then they cried out to the Lord in their trouble,
And He brought them out of their distresses.
107.29:
He caused the storm to be still,
So that the waves of the sea were hushed.
107.30:
Then they were glad because they were quiet,
So He guided them to their desired harbor.
107.31:
They shall give thanks to the Lord for His mercy,
And for His wonders to the sons of mankind!
107.32:
They shall also exalt Him in the congregation of the people,
And praise Him at the seat of the elders.
107.33:
He turns rivers into a wilderness,
And springs of water into a thirsty ground;
107.34:
And a fruitful land into a salt waste,
Because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it.
107.35:
He turns a wilderness into a pool of water,
And a dry land into springs of water;
107.36:
And He has the hungry live there,
So that they may establish an inhabited city,
107.37:
And sow fields and plant vineyards,
And gather a fruitful harvest.
107.38:
He also blesses them and they multiply greatly,
And He does not let their cattle decrease.
107.39:
When they become few and lowly
Because of oppression, misery, and sorrow,
107.40:
He pours contempt upon noblemen
And makes them wander in a pathless wasteland.
107.41:
But He sets the needy securely on high, away from affliction,
And makes his families like a flock.
107.42:
The upright see it and are glad;
But all injustice shuts its mouth.
107.43:
Who is wise? He is to pay attention to these things,
And consider the mercy of the Lord.

108.1:
My heart is steadfast, God;
I will sing, I will sing praises also with my soul.
108.2:
Awake, harp and lyre;
I will awaken the dawn!
108.3:
I will give thanks to You, Lord, among the peoples,
And I will sing praises to You among the nations.
108.4:
For Your mercy is great above the heavens,
And Your truth reaches to the skies.
108.5:
Be exalted above the heavens, God,
And may Your glory be above all the earth.
108.6:
So that Your beloved may be rescued,
Save with Your right hand, and answer me!
108.7:
God has spoken in His holiness:
“I will triumph, I will divide up Shechem,
And measure out the Valley of Succoth.
108.10:
Who will bring me into the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?
108.11:
God, have You Yourself not rejected us?
And will You not go forth with our armies, God?
108.12:
Give us help against the enemy,
For deliverance by man is worthless.
108.13:
Through God we will do valiantly,
And it is He who will trample down our enemies.

109.1:
God of my praise,
Do not be silent!
109.2:
For they have opened a wicked and deceitful mouth against me;
They have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
109.3:
They have also surrounded me with words of hatred,
And have fought against me without cause.
109.4:
In return for my love they act as my accusers;
But I am in prayer.
109.5:
So they have repaid me evil for good,
And hatred for my love.
109.6:
Appoint a wicked person over him,
And may an accuser stand at his right hand.
109.7:
When he is judged, may he come out guilty,
And may his prayer become sin.
109.8:
May his days be few;
May another take his office.
109.9:
May his children be fatherless,
And his wife a widow.
109.10:
May his children wander about and beg;
And may they seek sustenance far from their ruined homes.
109.11:
May the creditor seize everything that he has,
And may strangers plunder the product of his labor.
109.12:
May there be none to extend kindness to him,
Nor any to be gracious to his fatherless children.
109.13:
May his descendants be eliminated;
May their name be wiped out in a following generation.
109.14:
May the guilt of his fathers be remembered before the Lord,
And do not let the sin of his mother be wiped out.
109.15:
May they be before the Lord continually,
So that He may eliminate their memory from the earth;
109.16:
Because he did not remember to show mercy,
But persecuted the afflicted and needy person,
And the despondent in heart, to put them to death.
109.17:
He also loved cursing, so it came to him;
And he did not delight in blessing, so it was far from him.
109.18:
But he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment,
And it entered his body like water,
And like oil into his bones.
109.19:
May it be to him as a garment with which he covers himself,
And as a belt which he constantly wears around himself.
109.20:
May this be the reward of my accusers from the Lord,
And of those who speak evil against my soul.
109.21:
But You, God, the Lord, deal kindly with me for the sake of Your name;
Because Your mercy is good, rescue me;
109.22:
For I am afflicted and needy,
And my heart is wounded within me.
109.23:
I am passing like a shadow when it lengthens;
I am shaken off like the locust.
109.24:
My knees are weak from fasting,
And my flesh has grown lean, without fatness.
109.25:
I also have become a disgrace to them;
When they see me, they shake their head.
109.26:
Help me, Lord my God;
Save me according to Your mercy.
109.27:
And may they know that this is Your hand;
You, Lord, have done it.
109.29:
May my accusers be clothed with dishonor,
And may they cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
109.30:
With my mouth I will give thanks abundantly to the Lord;
And I will praise Him in the midst of many.
109.31:
For He stands at the right hand of the needy,
To save him from those who judge his soul.

110.1:
The Lord says to my Lord:
“Sit at My right hand
Until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”
110.2:
The Lord will stretch out Your strong scepter from Zion, saying,
“Rule in the midst of Your enemies.”
110.4:
The Lord has sworn and will not change His mind,
“You are a priest forever
According to the order of Melchizedek.”
110.5:
The Lord is at Your right hand;
He will shatter kings in the day of His wrath.
110.6:
He will judge among the nations,
He will fill them with corpses,
He will shatter the chief men over a broad country.
110.7:
He will drink from the brook by the wayside;
Therefore He will lift up His head.

111.1:
Praise the Lord!
I will give thanks to the Lord with all my heart,
In the company of the upright and in the assembly.
111.2:
Great are the works of the Lord;
They are studied by all who delight in them.
111.3:
Splendid and majestic is His work,
And His righteousness endures forever.
111.4:
He has caused His wonders to be remembered;
The Lord is gracious and compassionate.
111.5:
He has given food to those who fear Him;
He will remember His covenant forever.
111.6:
He has made known to His people the power of His works,
In giving them the inheritance of the nations.
111.7:
The works of His hands are truth and justice;
All His precepts are trustworthy.
111.8:
They are upheld forever and ever;
They are performed in truth and uprightness.

112.1:
Praise the Lord!
Blessed is a person who fears the Lord,
Who greatly delights in His commandments.
112.2:
His descendants will be mighty on the earth;
The generation of the upright will be blessed.
112.3:
Wealth and riches are in his house,
And his righteousness endures forever.
112.4:
Light shines in the darkness for the upright;
He is gracious, compassionate, and righteous.
112.5:
It goes well for a person who is gracious and lends;
He will maintain his cause in judgment.
112.6:
For he will never be shaken;
The righteous will be remembered forever.
112.7:
He will not fear bad news;
His heart is steadfast, trusting in the Lord.
112.8:
His heart is firm, he will not fear,
But will look with satisfaction on his enemies.

113.1:
Praise the Lord!
Praise Him, you servants of the Lord,
Praise the name of the Lord.
113.2:
Blessed be the name of the Lord
From this time on and forever.
113.3:
From the rising of the sun to its setting,
The name of the Lord is to be praised.
113.4:
The Lord is high above all nations;
His glory is above the heavens.
113.5:
Who is like the Lord our God,
Who is enthroned on high,
113.6:
Who looks far down to
The heavens and the earth?
113.7:
He raises the poor from the dust,
He lifts the needy from the garbage heap,
113.8:
To seat them with noblemen,
With the noblemen of His people.
113.9:
He has the infertile woman live in the house
As a joyful mother of children.
Praise the Lord!

114.1:
When Israel went forth from Egypt,
The house of Jacob from a people of a foreign language,
114.2:
Judah became His sanctuary;
Israel, His dominion.
114.3:
The sea looked and fled;
The Jordan turned back.
114.4:
The mountains skipped like rams,
The hills, like lambs.
114.5:
What ails you, sea, that you flee?
Jordan, that you turn back?
114.6:
Mountains, that you skip like rams?
Hills, like lambs?
114.7:
Tremble, earth, before the Lord,
Before the God of Jacob,
114.8:
Who turned the rock into a pool of water,
The flint into a fountain of water.

115.1:
Not to us, Lord, not to us,
But to Your name give glory,
Because of Your mercy, because of Your truth.
115.2:
Why should the nations say,
“Where, then, is their God?”
115.3:
But our God is in the heavens;
He does whatever He pleases.
115.4:
Their idols are silver and gold,
The work of human hands.
115.5:
They have mouths, but they cannot speak;
They have eyes, but they cannot see;
115.6:
They have ears, but they cannot hear;
They have noses, but they cannot smell;
115.8:
Those who make them will become like them,
Everyone who trusts in them.
115.9:
Israel, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
115.10:
House of Aaron, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
115.11:
You who fear the Lord, trust in the Lord;
He is their help and their shield.
115.13:
He will bless those who fear the Lord,
The small together with the great.
115.14:
May the Lord increase you,
You and your children.
115.15:
May you be blessed of the Lord,
Maker of heaven and earth.
115.16:
The heavens are the heavens of the Lord,
But the earth He has given to the sons of mankind.
115.17:
The dead do not praise the Lord,
Nor do any who go down into silence;
115.18:
But as for us, we will bless the Lord
From this time and forever.
Praise the Lord!

116.1:
I love the Lord, because He hears
My voice and my pleas.
116.2:
Because He has inclined His ear to me,
Therefore I will call upon Him as long as I live.
116.4:
Then I called upon the name of the Lord:
“Please, Lord, save my life!”
116.5:
Gracious is the Lord, and righteous;
Yes, our God is compassionate.
116.6:
The Lord watches over the simple;
I was brought low, and He saved me.
116.7:
Return to your rest, my soul,
For the Lord has dealt generously with you.
116.8:
For You have rescued my soul from death,
My eyes from tears,
And my feet from stumbling.
116.9:
I shall walk before the Lord
In the land of the living.
116.10:
I believed when I said,
“I am greatly afflicted.”
116.11:
I said in my alarm,
“All people are liars.”
116.12:
What shall I repay to the Lord
For all His benefits to me?
116.13:
I will lift up the cup of salvation,
And call upon the name of the Lord.
116.14:
I will pay my vows to the Lord;
May it be in the presence of all His people!
116.15:
Precious in the sight of the Lord
Is the death of His godly ones.
116.16:
O Lord, I surely am Your slave,
I am Your slave, the son of Your female slave,
You have unfastened my restraints.
116.17:
I will offer You a sacrifice of thanksgiving,
And call upon the name of the Lord.
116.18:
I will pay my vows to the Lord,
May it be in the presence of all His people,
116.19:
In the courtyards of the Lord’s house,
In the midst of you, Jerusalem!
Praise the Lord!

117.1:
Praise the Lord, all nations;
Sing His praises, all peoples!
117.2:
For His mercy toward us is great,
And the truth of the Lord is everlasting.
Praise the Lord!

118.1:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His mercy is everlasting.
118.2:
Let Israel say,
“His mercy is everlasting.”
118.3:
Oh let the house of Aaron say,
“His mercy is everlasting.”
118.4:
Let those who fear the Lord say,
“His mercy is everlasting.”
118.5:
From my distress I called upon the Lord;
The Lord answered me and put me in an open space.
118.6:
The Lord is for me; I will not fear;
What can man do to me?
118.7:
The Lord is for me among those who help me;
Therefore I will look with satisfaction on those who hate me.
118.8:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
Than to trust in people.
118.9:
It is better to take refuge in the Lord
Than to trust in noblemen.
118.10:
All nations surrounded me;
In the name of the Lord I will certainly fend them off.
118.11:
They surrounded me, yes, they surrounded me;
In the name of the Lord I will certainly fend them off.
118.13:
You pushed me violently so that I was falling,
But the Lord helped me.
118.14:
The Lord is my strength and song,
And He has become my salvation.
118.15:
The sound of joyful shouting and salvation is in the tents of the righteous;
The right hand of the Lord performs valiantly.
118.16:
The right hand of the Lord is exalted;
The right hand of the Lord performs valiantly.
118.17:
I will not die, but live,
And tell of the works of the Lord.
118.18:
The Lord has disciplined me severely,
But He has not turned me over to death.
118.19:
Open the gates of righteousness to me;
