I will enter through them, I will give thanks to the Lord.
118.20:
This is the gate of the Lord;
The righteous will enter through it.
118.21:
I will give thanks to You, for You have answered me,
And You have become my salvation.
118.22:
A stone which the builders rejected
Has become the chief cornerstone.
118.23:
This came about from the Lord;
It is marvelous in our eyes.
118.24:
This is the day which the Lord has made;
Let’s rejoice and be glad in it.
118.25:
Please, O Lord, do save us;
Please, O Lord, do send prosperity!
118.26:
Blessed is the one who comes in the name of the Lord;
We have blessed you from the house of the Lord.
118.27:
The Lord is God, and He has given us light;
Bind the festival sacrifice to the horns of the altar with cords.
118.28:
You are my God, and I give thanks to You;
You are my God, I exalt You.
118.29:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good;
For His mercy is everlasting.

119.1:
Blessed are those whose way is blameless,
Who walk in the Law of the Lord.
119.2:
Blessed are those who comply with His testimonies,
And seek Him with all their heart.
119.3:
They also do no injustice;
They walk in His ways.
119.4:
You have ordained Your precepts,
That we are to keep them diligently.
119.5:
Oh that my ways may be established
To keep Your statutes!
119.6:
Then I will not be ashamed
When I look at all Your commandments.
119.7:
I will give thanks to You with uprightness of heart,
When I learn Your righteous judgments.
119.8:
I will keep Your statutes;
Do not utterly abandon me!
119.9:
How can a young man keep his way pure?
By keeping it according to Your word.
119.10:
With all my heart I have sought You;
Do not let me wander from Your commandments.
119.11:
I have treasured Your word in my heart,
So that I may not sin against You.
119.12:
Blessed are You, Lord;
Teach me Your statutes.
119.13:
With my lips I have told of
All the ordinances of Your mouth.
119.14:
I have rejoiced in the way of Your testimonies,
As much as in all riches.
119.15:
I will meditate on Your precepts
And regard Your ways.
119.16:
I shall delight in Your statutes;
I will not forget Your word.
119.17:
Deal generously with Your servant,
That I may live and keep Your word.
119.18:
Open my eyes, that I may behold
Wonderful things from Your Law.
119.19:
I am a stranger on the earth;
Do not hide Your commandments from me.
119.20:
My soul is crushed with longing
For Your ordinances at all times.
119.21:
You rebuke the arrogant, the cursed,
Who wander from Your commandments.
119.22:
Take disgrace and contempt away from me,
For I comply with Your testimonies.
119.23:
Even though rulers sit and speak against me,
Your servant meditates on Your statutes.
119.24:
Your testimonies also are my delight;
They are my advisers.
119.25:
My soul clings to the dust;
Revive me according to Your word.
119.26:
I have told of my ways, and You have answered me;
Teach me Your statutes.
119.27:
Make me understand the way of Your precepts,
And I will meditate on Your wonders.
119.28:
My soul weeps because of grief;
Strengthen me according to Your word.
119.29:
Remove the false way from me,
And graciously grant me Your Law.
119.30:
I have chosen the faithful way;
I have placed Your judgments before me.
119.31:
I cling to Your testimonies;
Lord, do not put me to shame!
119.32:
I shall run the way of Your commandments,
For You will enlarge my heart.
119.33:
Teach me, the way of Your statutes, Lord,
And I shall comply with it to the end.
119.34:
Give me understanding, so that I may comply with Your Law
And keep it with all my heart.
119.35:
Make me walk in the path of Your commandments,
For I delight in it.
119.36:
Incline my heart to Your testimonies,
And not to dishonest gain.
119.37:
Turn my eyes away from looking at what is worthless,
And revive me in Your ways.
119.38:
Establish Your word to Your servant
As that which produces reverence for You.
119.39:
Take away my disgrace which I dread,
For Your judgments are good.
119.40:
Behold, I long for Your precepts;
Revive me through Your righteousness.
119.41:
May Your favor also come to me, Lord,
Your salvation according to Your word;
119.42:
So that I will have an answer for one who taunts me,
For I trust in Your word.
119.43:
And do not take the word of truth utterly out of my mouth,
For I wait for Your judgments.
119.44:
So I will keep Your Law continually,
Forever and ever.
119.45:
And I will walk at liberty,
For I seek Your precepts.
119.46:
I will also speak of Your testimonies before kings
And shall not be ashamed.
119.47:
I will delight in Your commandments,
Which I love.
119.49:
Remember the word to Your servant,
In which You have made me hope.
119.50:
This is my comfort in my misery,
That Your word has revived me.
119.51:
The arrogant utterly deride me,
Yet I do not turn aside from Your Law.
119.52:
I have remembered Your judgments from of old, Lord,
And comfort myself.
119.53:
Burning indignation has seized me because of the wicked,
Who abandon Your Law.
119.54:
Your statutes are my songs
In the house of my pilgrimage.
119.55:
Lord, I remember Your name in the night,
And keep Your Law.
119.56:
This has become mine,
That I comply with Your precepts.
119.57:
The Lord is my portion;
I have promised to keep Your words.
119.58:
I sought Your favor with all my heart;
Be gracious to me according to Your word.
119.59:
I considered my ways
And turned my feet to Your testimonies.
119.60:
I hurried and did not delay
To keep Your commandments.
119.61:
The snares of the wicked have surrounded me,
But I have not forgotten Your Law.
119.62:
At midnight I will rise to give thanks to You
Because of Your righteous judgments.
119.63:
I am a companion to all those who fear You,
And to those who keep Your precepts.
119.64:
The earth is full of Your goodness, Lord;
Teach me Your statutes.
119.65:
You have treated Your servant well,
Lord, according to Your word.
119.66:
Teach me good discernment and knowledge,
For I believe in Your commandments.
119.67:
Before I was afflicted I went astray,
But now I keep Your word.
119.68:
You are good and You do good;
Teach me Your statutes.
119.69:
The arrogant have forged a lie against me;
With all my heart I will comply with Your precepts.
119.70:
Their heart is insensitive, like fat,
But I delight in Your Law.
119.71:
It is good for me that I was afflicted,
So that I may learn Your statutes.
119.72:
The Law of Your mouth is better to me
Than thousands of gold and silver pieces.
119.73:
Your hands made me and fashioned me;
Give me understanding, so that I may learn Your commandments.
119.74:
May those who fear You see me and be glad,
Because I wait for Your word.
119.75:
I know, Lord, that Your judgments are righteous,
And that You have afflicted me in faithfulness.
119.76:
May Your favor comfort me,
According to Your word to Your servant.
119.77:
May Your compassion come to me so that I may live,
For Your Law is my delight.
119.78:
May the arrogant be put to shame, because they lead me astray with a lie;
But I shall meditate on Your precepts.
119.79:
May those who fear You turn to me,
And those who know Your testimonies.
119.80:
May my heart be blameless in Your statutes,
So that I will not be ashamed.
119.81:
My soul languishes for Your salvation;
I wait for Your word.
119.82:
My eyes fail with longing for Your word,
While I say, “When will You comfort me?”
119.83:
Though I have become like a wineskin in the smoke,
I do not forget Your statutes.
119.84:
How many are the days of Your servant?
When will You execute judgment on those who persecute me?
119.85:
The arrogant have dug pits for me,
People who are not in accord with Your Law.
119.86:
All Your commandments are faithful;
They have persecuted me with a lie; help me!
119.87:
They almost destroyed me on earth,
But as for me, I did not abandon Your precepts.
119.88:
Revive me according to Your faithfulness,
So that I may keep the testimony of Your mouth.
119.89:
Forever, Lord,
Your word stands in heaven.
119.90:
Your faithfulness continues throughout generations;
You established the earth, and it stands.
119.91:
They stand this day by Your ordinances,
For all things are Your servants.
119.92:
If Your Law had not been my delight,
Then I would have perished in my misery.
119.93:
I will never forget Your precepts,
For by them You have revived me.
119.94:
I am Yours, save me;
For I have sought Your precepts.
119.95:
The wicked wait for me to destroy me;
I will diligently consider Your testimonies.
119.96:
I have seen a limit to all perfection;
Your commandment is exceedingly broad.
119.97:
How I love Your Law!
It is my meditation all the day.
119.98:
Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
For they are ever mine.
119.99:
I have more insight than all my teachers,
For Your testimonies are my meditation.
119.100:
I understand more than those who are old,
Because I have complied with Your precepts.
119.101:
I have restrained my feet from every evil way,
So that I may keep Your word.
119.102:
I have not turned aside from Your judgments,
For You Yourself have taught me.
119.103:
How sweet are Your words to my taste!
Yes, sweeter than honey to my mouth!
119.104:
From Your precepts I get understanding;
Therefore I hate every false way.
119.105:
Your word is a lamp to my feet
And a light to my path.
119.106:
I have sworn and I will confirm it,
That I will keep Your righteous judgments.
119.107:
I am exceedingly afflicted;
Revive me, Lord, according to Your word.
119.108:
Be pleased to accept the voluntary offerings of my mouth, Lord,
And teach me Your judgments.
119.109:
My life is continually in my hand,
Yet I do not forget Your Law.
119.110:
The wicked have set a trap for me,
Yet I have not wandered from Your precepts.
119.111:
I have inherited Your testimonies forever,
For they are the joy of my heart.
119.112:
I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes
Forever, even to the end.
119.113:
I hate those who are double-minded,
But I love Your Law.
119.114:
You are my hiding place and my shield;
I wait for Your word.
119.115:
Leave me, you evildoers,
So that I may comply with the commandments of my God.
119.116:
Sustain me according to Your word, that I may live;
And do not let me be ashamed of my hope.
119.117:
Sustain me so that I may be safe,
That I may have regard for Your statutes continually.
119.118:
You have rejected all those who stray from Your statutes,
For their deceitfulness is useless.
119.119:
You have removed all the wicked of the earth like impurities;
Therefore I love Your testimonies.
119.120:
My flesh trembles from the fear of You,
And I am afraid of Your judgments.
119.121:
I have done justice and righteousness;
Do not leave me to my oppressors.
119.122:
Be a guarantor for Your servant for good;
Do not let the arrogant oppress me.
119.123:
My eyes fail with longing for Your salvation,
And for Your righteous word.
119.124:
Deal with Your servant according to Your graciousness,
And teach me Your statutes.
119.125:
I am Your servant; give me understanding,
So that I may know Your testimonies.
119.126:
It is time for the Lord to act,
For they have broken Your Law.
119.127:
Therefore I love Your commandments
Above gold, yes, above pure gold.
119.128:
Therefore I carefully follow all Your precepts concerning everything,
I hate every false way.
119.129:
Your testimonies are wonderful;
Therefore my soul complies with them.
119.130:
The unfolding of Your words gives light;
It gives understanding to the simple.
119.131:
I opened my mouth wide and panted,
For I longed for Your commandments.
119.132:
Turn to me and be gracious to me,
As is right for those who love Your name.
119.133:
Establish my footsteps in Your word,
And do not let any wrongdoing have power over me.
119.134:
Redeem me from oppression by man,
So that I may keep Your precepts.
119.135:
Make Your face shine upon Your servant,
And teach me Your statutes.
119.136:
My eyes shed streams of water,
Because they do not keep Your Law.
119.137:
You are righteous, Lord,
And Your judgments are right.
119.138:
You have commanded Your testimonies in righteousness
And great faithfulness.
119.139:
My zeal has consumed me,
Because my enemies have forgotten Your words.
119.140:
Your word is very pure,
Therefore Your servant loves it.
119.141:
I am small and despised,
Yet I do not forget Your precepts.
119.142:
Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness,
And Your Law is truth.
119.143:
Trouble and anguish have come upon me,
Yet Your commandments are my delight.
119.144:
Your testimonies are righteous forever;
Give me understanding that I may live.
119.145:
I cried out with all my heart; answer me, Lord!
I will comply with Your statutes.
119.146:
I cried to You; save me
And I shall keep Your testimonies.
119.147:
I rise before dawn and cry for help;
I wait for Your words.
119.148:
My eyes anticipate the night watches,
So that I may meditate on Your word.
119.149:
Hear my voice according to Your faithfulness;
Revive me, Lord, according to Your judgments.
119.150:
Those who follow after wickedness approach;
They are far from Your Law.
119.151:
You are near, Lord,
And all Your commandments are truth.
119.152:
From long ago I have known from Your testimonies
That You have founded them forever.
119.153:
Look at my affliction and rescue me,
For I have not forgotten Your Law.
119.154:
Plead my cause and redeem me;
Revive me according to Your word.
119.155:
Salvation is far from the wicked,
For they do not seek Your statutes.
119.156:
Great are Your mercies, Lord;
Revive me according to Your judgments.
119.157:
Many are my persecutors and my enemies,
Yet I do not turn aside from Your testimonies.
119.158:
I see the treacherous and loathe them,
Because they do not keep Your word.
119.159:
Consider how I love Your precepts;
Revive me, Lord, according to Your faithfulness.
119.160:
The sum of Your word is truth,
And every one of Your righteous judgments is everlasting.
119.161:
Rulers persecute me without cause,
But my heart stands in awe of Your words.
119.162:
I rejoice at Your word,
Like one who finds great plunder.
119.163:
I hate and loathe falsehood,
But I love Your Law.
119.164:
Seven times a day I praise You
Because of Your righteous judgments.
119.165:
Those who love Your Law have great peace,
And nothing causes them to stumble.
119.166:
I hope for Your salvation, Lord,
And do Your commandments.
119.167:
My soul keeps Your testimonies,
And I love them exceedingly.
119.168:
I keep Your precepts and Your testimonies,
For all my ways are before You.
119.169:
Let my cry come before You, Lord;
Give me understanding according to Your word.
119.170:
Let my pleading come before You;
Save me according to Your word.
119.171:
Let my lips pour out praise,
For You teach me Your statutes.
119.172:
Let my tongue sing about Your word,
For all Your commandments are righteousness.
119.173:
Let Your hand be ready to help me,
For I have chosen Your precepts.
119.174:
I long for Your salvation, Lord,
And Your Law is my delight.
119.175:
Let my soul live that it may praise You,
And let Your ordinances help me.
119.176:
I have wandered about like a lost sheep; search for Your servant,
For I do not forget Your commandments.

120.1:
I cried to the Lord in my trouble,
And He answered me.
120.2:
Rescue my soul, Lord, from lying lips,
From a deceitful tongue.
120.3:
What will He give to you, and what more will He do to you,
You deceitful tongue?
120.4:
Sharp arrows of the warrior,
With the burning coals of the broom tree!
120.5:
Woe to me, for I reside in Meshech,
For I have settled among the tents of Kedar!
120.6:
Too long has my soul had its dwelling
With those who hate peace.
120.7:
I am for peace, but when I speak,
They are for war.

121.1:
I will raise my eyes to the mountains;
From where will my help come?
121.2:
My help comes from the Lord,
Who made heaven and earth.
121.3:
He will not allow your foot to slip;
He who watches over you will not slumber.
121.4:
Behold, He who watches over Israel
Will neither slumber nor sleep.
121.5:
The Lord is your protector;
The Lord is your shade on your right hand.
121.6:
The sun will not beat down on you by day,
Nor the moon by night.
121.7:
The Lord will protect you from all evil;
He will keep your soul.
121.8:
The Lord will guard your going out and your coming in
From this time and forever.

122.1:
I was glad when they said to me,
“Let’s go to the house of the Lord.”
122.2:
Our feet are standing
Within your gates, Jerusalem,
122.3:
Jerusalem, that has been built
As a city that is firmly joined together;
122.4:
To which the tribes go up, the tribes of the Lord—
An ordinance for Israel—
To give thanks to the name of the Lord.
122.5:
For thrones were set there for judgment,
The thrones of the house of David.
122.6:
Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May they prosper who love you.
122.7:
May peace be within your walls,
And prosperity within your palaces.”
122.8:
For the sake of my brothers and my friends,
I will now say, “May peace be within you.”
122.9:
For the sake of the house of the Lord our God,
I will seek your good.

123.1:
To You I have raised my eyes,
You who are enthroned in the heavens!
123.2:
Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master,
As the eyes of a female servant to the hand of her mistress,
So our eyes look to the Lord our God,
Until He is gracious to us.
123.3:
Be gracious to us, Lord, be gracious to us,
For we have had much more than enough of contempt.
123.4:
Our soul has had much more than enough
Of the scoffing of those who are at ease,
And with the contempt of the proud.

124.1:
“Had it not been the Lord who was on our side,”
Let Israel say,
124.2:
“Had it not been the Lord who was on our side
When people rose up against us,
124.3:
Then they would have swallowed us alive,
When their anger was kindled against us;
124.4:
Then the waters would have flooded over us,
The stream would have swept over our souls;
124.5: Then the raging waters would have swept over our souls.”
124.6:
Blessed be the Lord,
Who has not given us to be torn by their teeth.
124.7:
Our souls have escaped like a bird from the trapper’s snare;
The snare is broken and we have escaped.
124.8:
Our help is in the name of the Lord,
Who made heaven and earth.

125.1:
Those who trust in the Lord
Are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved but remains forever.
125.2:
As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
So the Lord surrounds His people
From this time and forever.
125.3:
For the scepter of wickedness will not rest upon the land of the righteous,
So that the righteous will not extend their hands to do wrong.
125.4:
Do good, Lord, to those who are good
And to those who are upright in their hearts.
125.5:
But as for those who turn aside to their crooked ways,
The Lord will lead them away with those who practice injustice.
Peace be upon Israel.

126.1:
When the Lord brought back the captives of Zion,
We were like those who dream.
126.2:
Then our mouth was filled with laughter
And our tongue with joyful shouting;
Then they said among the nations,
“The Lord has done great things for them.”
126.3:
The Lord has done great things for us;
We are joyful.
126.4:
Restore our fortunes, Lord,
As the streams in the South.
126.5: Those who sow in tears shall harvest with joyful shouting.
126.6:
One who goes here and there weeping, carrying his bag of seed,
Shall indeed come again with a shout of joy, bringing his sheaves with him.

127.1:
Unless the Lord builds a house,
They who build it labor in vain;
Unless the Lord guards a city,
The watchman stays awake in vain.
127.2:
It is futile for you to rise up early,
To stay up late,
To eat the bread of painful labor;
This is how He gives to His beloved sleep.
127.3:
Behold, children are a gift of the Lord,
The fruit of the womb is a reward.
127.4:
Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
So are the children of one’s youth.

128.1:
Blessed is everyone who fears the Lord,
Who walks in His ways.
128.2:
When you eat the fruit of the labor of your hands,
You will be happy and it will go well for you.
128.3:
Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
Within your house,
Your children like olive plants
Around your table.
128.4:
Behold, for so shall a man
Who fears the Lord be blessed.
128.5:
The Lord bless you from Zion,
And may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life.
128.6:
Indeed, may you see your children’s children.
Peace be upon Israel!

129.1:
“Many times they have attacked me from my youth up,”
Let Israel say,
129.2:
“Many times they have attacked me from my youth up;
Yet they have not prevailed against me.
129.3:
The plowers plowed upon my back;
They lengthened their furrows.”
129.4:
The Lord is righteous;
He has cut up the ropes of the wicked.
129.5:
May all who hate Zion
Be put to shame and turned backward;
129.6:
May they be like grass upon the housetops,
Which withers before it grows up;
129.7:
With which the harvester does not fill his hand,
Or the binder of sheaves his arms;

130.1: Out of the depths I have cried to You, Lord.
130.2:
Lord, hear my voice!
Let Your ears be attentive
To the sound of my pleadings.
130.3:
If You, Lord, were to keep account of guilty deeds,
Lord, who could stand?
130.4:
But there is forgiveness with You,
So that You may be revered.
130.5:
I wait for the Lord, my soul waits,
And I wait for His word.
130.8:
And He will redeem Israel
From all his guilty deeds.

131.3:
Israel, wait for the Lord
From this time on and forever.

132.1:
Remember, Lord, in David’s behalf,
All his affliction;
132.2:
How he swore to the Lord
And vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob,
132.3:
“I certainly will not enter my house,
Nor lie on my bed;
132.4:
I will not give sleep to my eyes
Or slumber to my eyelids,
132.5:
Until I find a place for the Lord,
A dwelling place for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
132.6:
Behold, we heard about it in Ephrathah,
We found it in the field of Jaar.
132.7:
Let’s go into His dwelling place;
Let’s worship at His footstool.
132.8:
Arise, Lord, to Your resting place,
You and the ark of Your strength.
132.9:
May Your priests be clothed with righteousness,
And may Your godly ones sing for joy.
132.10:
For the sake of Your servant David,
Do not turn away the face of Your anointed.
132.11:
The Lord has sworn to David
A truth from which He will not turn back:
“I will set upon your throne one from the fruit of your body.
132.12:
If your sons will keep My covenant
And My testimony which I will teach them,
Their sons also will sit upon your throne forever.”
132.13:
For the Lord has chosen Zion;
He has desired it as His dwelling place.
132.14:
“This is My resting place forever;
Here I will dwell, for I have desired it.
132.15:
I will abundantly bless her food;
I will satisfy her needy with bread.
132.16:
I will also clothe her priests with salvation,
And her godly ones will sing aloud for joy.
132.17:
I will make the horn of David spring forth there;
I have prepared a lamp for My anointed.
132.18:
I will clothe his enemies with shame,
But upon himself his crown will gleam.”

133.1:
Behold, how good and how pleasant it is
For brothers to live together in unity!
133.2:
It is like the precious oil on the head,
Running down upon the beard,
As on Aaron’s beard,
The oil which ran down upon the edge of his robes.

134.1:
Behold, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord,
Who serve by night in the house of the Lord!
134.2:
Lift up your hands to the sanctuary
And bless the Lord.
134.3:
May the Lord bless you from Zion,
He who made heaven and earth.

135.2:
You who stand in the house of the Lord,
In the courtyards of the house of our God!
135.3:
Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good;
Sing praises to His name, for it is lovely.
135.4:
For the Lord has chosen Jacob for Himself,
Israel as His own possession.
135.5:
For I know that the Lord is great
And that our Lord is above all gods.
135.6:
Whatever the Lord pleases, He does,
In heaven and on earth, in the seas and in all the ocean depths.
135.8:
He struck the firstborn of Egypt,
Both human firstborn and animal.
135.9:
He sent signs and wonders into your midst, Egypt,
Upon Pharaoh and all his servants.
135.10:
He struck many nations
And brought death to mighty kings,
135.12:
And He gave their land as an inheritance,
An inheritance to His people Israel.
135.13:
Your name, Lord, is everlasting,
The mention of You, Lord, is throughout all generations.
135.14:
For the Lord will judge His people
And will have compassion on His servants.
135.15:
The idols of the nations are nothing but silver and gold,
The work of human hands.
135.16:
They have mouths, but they do not speak;
They have eyes, but they do not see;
135.17:
They have ears, but they do not hear,
Nor is there any breath at all in their mouths.
135.18:
Those who make them will become like them,
Yes, everyone who trusts in them.
135.19:
House of Israel, bless the Lord;
House of Aaron, bless the Lord;
135.20:
House of Levi, bless the Lord;
You who revere the Lord, bless the Lord.
135.21:
Blessed be the Lord from Zion,
Who dwells in Jerusalem.
Praise the Lord!

136.1:
Give thanks to the Lord, for He is good,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.2:
Give thanks to the God of gods,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.3:
Give thanks to the Lord of lords,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.4:
To Him who alone does great wonders,
For His faithfulness is everlasting;
136.5:
To Him who made the heavens with skill,
For His faithfulness is everlasting;
136.6:
To Him who spread out the earth above the waters,
For His faithfulness is everlasting;
136.7:
To Him who made the great lights,
For His faithfulness is everlasting:
136.8:
The sun to rule by day,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.9:
The moon and stars to rule by night,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.10:
To Him who struck the Egyptians, that is, their firstborn,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.11:
And brought Israel out from their midst,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.12:
With a strong hand and an outstretched arm,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.13:
To Him who divided the Red Sea in parts,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.14:
And allowed Israel to pass through the midst of it,
For His faithfulness is everlasting;
136.15:
But He overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.16:
To Him who led His people through the wilderness,
For His faithfulness is everlasting;
136.17:
To Him who struck great kings,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.18:
And brought death to mighty kings,
For His faithfulness is everlasting:
136.19:
Sihon, king of the Amorites,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.20:
And Og, king of Bashan,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.21:
And gave their land as an inheritance,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.22:
An inheritance to His servant Israel,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.23:
Who remembered us in our lowliness,
For His faithfulness is everlasting,
136.24:
And has rescued us from our enemies,
For His faithfulness is everlasting;
136.25:
Who gives food to all flesh,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.
136.26:
Give thanks to the God of heaven,
For His faithfulness is everlasting.

137.1:
By the rivers of Babylon,
There we sat down and wept,
When we remembered Zion.
137.2:
Upon the willows in the midst of it
We hung our harps.
137.3:
For there our captors demanded of us songs,
And our tormentors, jubilation, saying,
“Sing for us one of the songs of Zion!”
137.4:
How can we sing the Lord’s song
In a foreign land?
137.5:
If I forget you, Jerusalem,
May my right hand forget its skill.
137.6:
May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth
If I do not remember you,
If I do not exalt Jerusalem
Above my chief joy.
137.7:
Remember, Lord, against the sons of Edom
The day of Jerusalem,
Those who said, “Lay it bare, lay it bare
To its foundation!”
137.8:
Daughter of Babylon, you devastated one,
Blessed will be one who repays you
With the retribution with which you have repaid us.
137.9:
Blessed will be one who seizes and dashes your children
Against the rock.

138.1:
I will give You thanks with all my heart;
I will sing Your praises before the gods.
138.3:
On the day I called, You answered me;
You made me bold with strength in my soul.
138.4:
All the kings of the earth will give thanks to You, Lord,
When they have heard the words of Your mouth.
138.5:
And they will sing of the ways of the Lord,
For great is the glory of the Lord.
138.6:
For the Lord is exalted,
Yet He looks after the lowly,
But He knows the haughty from afar.

139.1: Lord, You have searched me and known me.
139.2:
You know when I sit down and when I get up;
You understand my thought from far away.
139.3:
You scrutinize my path and my lying down,
And are acquainted with all my ways.
139.4:
Even before there is a word on my tongue,
Behold, Lord, You know it all.
139.5:
You have encircled me behind and in front,
And placed Your hand upon me.
139.6:
Such knowledge is too wonderful for me;
It is too high, I cannot comprehend it.
139.7:
Where can I go from Your Spirit?
Or where can I flee from Your presence?
139.8:
If I ascend to heaven, You are there;
If I make my bed in Sheol, behold, You are there.
139.9:
If I take up the wings of the dawn,
If I dwell in the remotest part of the sea,
139.10:
Even there Your hand will lead me,
And Your right hand will take hold of me.
139.11:
If I say, “Surely the darkness will overwhelm me,
And the light around me will be night,”
139.12:
Even darkness is not dark to You,
And the night is as bright as the day.
Darkness and light are alike to You.
139.13:
For You created my innermost parts;
You wove me in my mother’s womb.
139.16:
Your eyes have seen my formless substance;
And in Your book were written
All the days that were ordained for me,
When as yet there was not one of them.
139.17:
How precious also are Your thoughts for me, God!
How vast is the sum of them!
139.18:
Were I to count them, they would outnumber the sand.
When I awake, I am still with You.
139.19:
If only You would put the wicked to death, God;
Leave me, you men of bloodshed.
139.20:
For they speak against You wickedly,
And Your enemies take Your name in vain.
139.21:
Do I not hate those who hate You, Lord?
And do I not loathe those who rise up against You?
139.22:
I hate them with the utmost hatred;
They have become my enemies.
139.23:
Search me, God, and know my heart;
Put me to the test and know my anxious thoughts;
139.24:
And see if there is any hurtful way in me,
And lead me in the everlasting way.

140.1:
Rescue me, Lord, from evil people;
Protect me from violent men
140.2:
Who devise evil things in their hearts;
They continually stir up wars.
140.3:
They sharpen their tongues like a snake;
The venom of a viper is under their lips. Selah
140.6:
I said to the Lord, “You are my God;
Listen, Lord, to the sound of my pleadings.
140.7:
God the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
You have covered my head on the day of battle.
140.8:
Do not grant, Lord, the desires of the wicked;
Do not bring about his evil planning, so that they are not exalted. Selah
140.9:
“As for the head of those who surround me,
May the harm of their lips cover them.
140.11:
May a slanderer not endure on the earth;
May evil hunt a violent person violently.”
140.12:
I know that the Lord will maintain the cause of the afflicted,
And justice for the poor.
140.13:
Certainly the righteous will give thanks to Your name;
The upright will dwell in Your presence.

141.1:
Lord, I call upon You; hurry to me!
Listen to my voice when I call to You!
141.2:
May my prayer be counted as incense before You;
The raising of my hands as the evening offering.
141.3:
Set a guard, Lord, over my mouth;
Keep watch over the door of my lips.
141.4:
Do not incline my heart to any evil thing,
To practice deeds of wickedness
With people who do wrong;
And may I not taste their delicacies.
141.6:
Their judges are thrown down by the sides of the rock,
And they hear my words, for they are pleasant.
141.7:
As when one plows and breaks open the earth,
Our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
141.8:
For my eyes are toward You, God, the Lord;
In You I take refuge; do not leave me defenseless.
141.9:
Keep me from the jaws of the trap which they have set for me,
And from the snares of those who do wrong.
141.10:
May the wicked fall into their own nets,
While I pass by safely.

142.1:
I cry out with my voice to the Lord;
With my voice I implore the Lord for compassion.
142.2:
I pour out my complaint before Him;
I declare my trouble before Him.
142.3:
When my spirit felt weak within me,
You knew my path.
In the way where I walk
They have hidden a trap for me.
142.6:
Give Your attention to my cry,
For I have been brought very low;
Rescue me from my persecutors,
For they are too strong for me.
142.7:
Bring my soul out of prison,
So that I may give thanks to Your name;
The righteous will surround me,
For You will look after me.”

143.1:
Hear my prayer, Lord,
Listen to my pleadings!
Answer me in Your faithfulness, in Your righteousness!
143.2:
And do not enter into judgment with Your servant,
For no person living is righteous in Your sight.
143.4:
Therefore my spirit feels weak within me;
My heart is appalled within me.
143.6:
I spread out my hands to You;
My soul longs for You, like a weary land. Selah
143.9:
Save me, Lord, from my enemies;
I take refuge in You.
143.11:
For the sake of Your name, Lord, revive me.
In Your righteousness bring my soul out of trouble.
143.12:
And in Your faithfulness, destroy my enemies,
And eliminate all those who attack my soul,
For I am Your servant.

144.2:
My faithfulness and my fortress,
My stronghold and my savior,
My shield and He in whom I take refuge,
Who subdues my people under me.
144.3:
Lord, what is man, that You look after him?
Or a son of man, that You think of him?
144.4:
Man is like the breath;
His days are like a passing shadow.
144.5:
Bend down Your heavens, Lord, and come down;
Touch the mountains, that they may smoke.
144.6:
Flash forth lightning and scatter them;
Send out Your arrows and confuse them.
144.8:
Whose mouth speaks deceit,
And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.9:
God, I will sing a new song to You;
On a harp of ten strings I will sing praises to You,
144.10:
Who gives salvation to kings,
Who rescues His servant David from the evil sword.
144.11:
Rescue me and save me from the hand of foreigners,
Whose mouth speaks deceit
And whose right hand is a right hand of falsehood.
144.12:
When our sons in their youth are like growing plants,
And our daughters like corner pillars fashioned for a palace,
144.13:
Our granaries are full, providing every kind of produce,
And our flocks deliver thousands and ten thousands in our fields;
144.14:
May our cattle be bred
Without mishap and without loss,
May there be no outcry in our streets!
144.15:
Blessed are the people who are so situated;
Blessed are the people whose God is the Lord!

145.1:
I will exalt You, my God, the King,
And I will bless Your name forever and ever.
145.2:
Every day I will bless You,
And I will praise Your name forever and ever.
145.3:
Great is the Lord, and highly to be praised;
And His greatness is unsearchable.
145.4:
One generation will praise Your works to another,
And will declare Your mighty acts.
145.5:
On the glorious splendor of Your majesty
And on Your wonderful works, I will meditate.
145.6:
People will speak of the power of Your awesome acts,
And I will tell of Your greatness.
145.7:
They will burst forth in speaking of Your abundant goodness,
And will shout joyfully of Your righteousness.
145.8:
The Lord is gracious and compassionate;
Slow to anger and great in mercy.
145.9:
The Lord is good to all,
And His mercies are over all His works.
145.10:
All Your works will give thanks to You, Lord,
And Your godly ones will bless You.
145.11:
They will speak of the glory of Your kingdom,
And talk of Your might,
145.12:
To make known to the sons of mankind Your mighty acts,
And the glory of the majesty of Your kingdom.
145.13:
Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
And Your dominion endures throughout all generations.
The Lord is faithful in His words,
And holy in all His works.
145.14:
The Lord supports all who fall,
And raises up all who are bowed down.
145.15:
The eyes of all look to You,
And You give them their food in due time.
145.16:
You open Your hand
And satisfy the desire of every living thing.
145.17:
The Lord is righteous in all His ways,
And kind in all His works.
145.18:
The Lord is near to all who call on Him,
To all who call on Him in truth.
145.19:
He will fulfill the desire of those who fear Him;
He will also hear their cry for help and save them.
145.20:
The Lord watches over all who love Him,
But He will destroy all the wicked.
145.21:
My mouth will speak the praise of the Lord,
And all flesh will bless His holy name forever and ever.

146.1:
Praise the Lord!
Praise the Lord, my soul!
146.2:
I will praise the Lord while I live;
I will sing praises to my God while I have my being.
146.3:
Do not trust in noblemen,
In mortal man, in whom there is no salvation.
146.4:
His spirit departs, he returns to the earth;
On that very day his plans perish.
146.5:
Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob,
Whose hope is in the Lord his God,
146.10:
The Lord will reign forever,
Your God, Zion, to all generations.
Praise the Lord!

147.2:
The Lord builds up Jerusalem;
He gathers the outcasts of Israel.
147.3:
He heals the brokenhearted
And binds up their wounds.
147.4:
He counts the number of the stars;
He gives names to all of them.
147.5:
Great is our Lord and abundant in strength;
His understanding is infinite.
147.6:
The Lord supports the afflicted;
He brings the wicked down to the ground.
147.7:
Sing to the Lord with thanksgiving;
Sing praises to our God on the lyre;
147.8:
It is He who covers the heavens with clouds,
Who provides rain for the earth,
Who makes grass sprout on the mountains.
147.9:
It is He who gives an animal its food,
And feeds young ravens that cry.
147.10:
He does not delight in the strength of the horse;
He does not take pleasure in the legs of a man.
147.11:
The Lord favors those who fear Him,
Those who wait for His faithfulness.
147.12:
Praise the Lord, Jerusalem!
Praise your God, Zion!
147.13:
For He has strengthened the bars of your gates;
He has blessed your sons among you.
147.14:
He makes peace in your borders;
He satisfies you with the finest of the wheat.
147.15:
He sends His command to the earth;
His word runs very swiftly.
147.16:
He showers snow like wool;
He scatters the frost like ashes.
147.17:
He hurls His ice as fragments;
Who can stand before His cold?
147.18:
He sends His word and makes them melt;
He makes His wind blow, and the waters flow.
147.19:
He declares His words to Jacob,
His statutes and His judgments to Israel.

148.2:
Praise Him, all His angels;
Praise Him, all His heavenly armies!
148.3:
Praise Him, sun and moon;
Praise Him, all stars of light!
148.4:
Praise Him, highest heavens,
And the waters that are above the heavens!
148.5:
They are to praise the name of the Lord,
For He commanded and they were created.
148.6:
He has also established them forever and ever;
He has made a decree, and it will not pass away.
148.7:
Praise the Lord from the earth,
Sea monsters, and all the ocean depths;
148.8:
Fire and hail, snow and clouds;
Stormy wind, fulfilling His word;
148.9:
Mountains and all hills;
Fruit trees and all cedars;
148.10:
Animals and all cattle;
Crawling things and winged fowl;
148.11:
Kings of the earth and all peoples;
Rulers and all judges of the earth;
148.12:
Both young men and virgins;
Old men and children.
148.14:
And He has lifted up a horn for His people,
Praise for all His godly ones,
For the sons of Israel, a people near to Him.
Praise the Lord!

149.1:
Praise the Lord!
Sing a new song to the Lord,
And His praise in the congregation of the godly ones.
149.2:
Israel shall be joyful in his Maker;
The sons of Zion shall rejoice in their King.
149.3:
They shall praise His name with dancing;
They shall sing praises to Him with tambourine and lyre.
149.4:
For the Lord takes pleasure in His people;
He will glorify the lowly with salvation.
149.5:
The godly ones shall be jubilant in glory;
They shall sing for joy on their beds.
149.6:
The high praises of God shall be in their mouths,
And a two-edged sword in their hands,
149.7:
To execute vengeance on the nations,
And punishment on the peoples,
149.8:
To bind their kings with chains,
And their dignitaries with shackles of iron,
149.9:
To execute against them the judgment written.
This is an honor for all His godly ones.
Praise the Lord!

150.2:
Praise Him for His mighty deeds;
Praise Him according to His excellent greatness.
150.3:
Praise Him with trumpet sound;
Praise Him with harp and lyre.
150.4:
Praise Him with tambourine and dancing;
Praise Him with stringed instruments and flute.
150.5:
Praise Him with loud cymbals;
Praise Him with resounding cymbals.
150.6:
Everything that has breath shall praise the Lord.
Praise the Lord!
